This worked excellently for what it advertised. It obviously slides into the CD player slot of your car, and mine didn't have any problem with the head unit, as far as a CD thinking it was constantly being input or taken out.
It is sturdy, well build, and has a velvet soft back and sides to clasp your phone. My phone has the volume rockers on the side so I had to angle it "just so" that it wouldn't keep hitting the volume keys when I locked it into place. This was not an issue if I put it in landscape mode instead of portrait, but I didn't always want my phone that way. All the other reviews will answer your questions about the placement of the device, the build quality, and orientations/phones you can use with this. I want to address one thing that I either never thought of when I bought this, or it was never brought to my attention. For this to be stable it works like this, put your hands together like you just clapped them (prayer hands), palms and fingers flat. Now, while keeping your palms together, open your hands into a "V". This is the basic mechanics of the mount. It has grooves on the backside where it fits into your CD slot that open both ways when you apply the screw at the bottom. Obvious right? Well what didn't occur to me and may not occur to you, is this could damage your CD players input area. I had an aftermarket kenwood DVD player and once I applied enough pressure to make it stable, the top input area was visibly bowed outward. At first I was a little bothered but then figured what the heck, I don't use it anyway. A friend of mine gave me a new mix to listen to so I threw it in the DVD player, jacked it completely up, the disc not my player thank God. If you look in your input area on your CD/DVD player, there is a small felt or fibrous looking area that keeps debris out of your lasers eye. The use of this mount had pushed that material off it's "track" and was mostly inside my DVD player. They use some kind of industrial adhesive to keep it in place and so most of this had come off onto the disc. I was unable to reapply the input debris cover, and ended up getting rid of the player anyway (not because of this) but after that incident I didn't use it again. Now I have a bluetooth connection and just leave my phone in my pocket.
With this story told, just be aware of what you are purchasing, and how it works. This rating is NOT for the product itself, it works EXACTLY as advertised, and is well crafted, as for the starts, it literally means that I just thought it was "okay" for me. If you have any questions feel free to ask, and if this review helped please say so. Thanks.

reviewText:
The Aukey Dual port QC 3.0 charger is a unique charger in two ways :
1) It has DUAL Quick Charge 3.0 + AiPower (Smart Chip) compatible ports which detect non QC enabled devices as well
2) It is  officially licensed and certified by Qualcomm - Only a handful of  QC 3.0 chargers on the market are officially licencesd and even fewer that have dual QC 3.0 ports

Why is Qualcomm Certification Important ?
The way the Quick Charge technology works is by being able to supply a much higher amount of power and current to you phone than what non QC chargers are capable of . For  Example for a single USB Port  :
(Non QC) Charger Output Voltage  : 5V  ,  Max Power : >10 W
QC 3.0 Output Voltage  : 3.2v - 20v dynamic  ,  Max Power : 18W

So the Quick Charge technology not only requires the internal components to withstand the stresses of higher power levels but also strikes a very fine and delicate balance between practicality of faster charge times and the service life of your phone's battery. This is because charging a battery rapidly generates a lot of  heat and heat is bad for your battery's life. A Qualcomm certification ensures that your phone's battery is being charged at the fastest possible speeds without potentially damaging it. I would never trust my $700 phone with anything that has a remote chance of damaging its battery , Would you?

Pros
- Qualcomm Certified means it has been tested thoroughly and safer for your phones
- Two full speed QC 3.0 Ports which charge both the Samsung Galaxy S6's (QC 2.0 Compatible )  in my household very fast. About 59% in 30 mins which is right on the QC2.0 benchmark
- Despite being a fairly large charger, its designed practically - It does not block adjacent ports on your wall or Surge strips due to its slim profile
- Comes with a premium 20AWG charging Mirco USB cable
- 24 Month Warranty (most other brands offer only 12 or 18 Months)

Cons
- About the only thing i missed in this charger was a charging/power indicator light

Overall I really like the Aukey Dual Port QC 3.0 charger and highly recommend to you if you have more than one Quick Charge compatible device in your home. Its one of the few chargers available that offer dual QC3.0 ports with the added peace of mind of being Qualcomm Certified.
Disclosure :  I received a promotional sample for my review . The  views reflected are objective and my own.

reviewText: I have to say this is the my favorite case from otterbox I've owned. I have owned both the commuter and defender for my iPhone 5. The commuter was hard to get on and fit correctly but was a decent case providing good protection without turning your phone into a brick. The defender was a beast of a case but the plastic screen shield would degrade the screen clarity slightly and the open ear peice would allow dust to enter the case and get beneath it forcing you to take it apart and clean it if that kind of thing bothers you. For me it did I can't stand anything that takes away from my retina display. I decided to try the symmetry for my new iPhone 6 and I'm glad I did. This case gives two layers of protection in one single peice. Hard plastic and semihard rubber are blended together perfectly. Similar to the way a spec candyshell case is made but the rubber seems slightly better and less suseptible to peeling. If you have ever owned one you know what I mean. The plastic is a nice non reflective matte finish that feels high quality. Has a very nice raised edge around the face that's not too thick that it takes away from swiping up and down for notifications. This case is relatively thin for the amount of protection it provides. I would recommend a screen protector because this case does not come with one. The edges do cover the rounded edge of your glass screen so get a protecter that gives plenty of clearence or the case may peel the edges if it comes in contact with them. A glass screen protector would be perfect. All in all I am very impressed!

reviewText:
I am a stay at home mom and typically I have a stroller to put my iPhone in if we go for a good walk, but...I do go places now and then without my stroller!

I know the Red Star Tec iPhone 5 Sports Arm band AB701 is meant for exercising, but for me I go to Jazzercise and I do not want my phone on me at all during my workouts. So I am going to use this band for any time I need to cary my phone and do not have a pocket, stroller or purse. I have come across times like those and I wished I had a band like this!

My phone fits nice and securely and I am not worried about it falling out of the Red Star Tec band. I am again just using it for walking around, but soon Ill use it on a bike ride when my two year old starts riding his own bike and I don't have the bike trailer. The strap is the right size for my arm. I'm thin so I was not worried that it would not fit, especially since it is adjustable.

There is a little hidden pocket for a key which seems useful and I will probably use it when my kids and I do go on those bike rides. My band is blue and grey. I like the color and it seems like it will be easy to clean and wash.

I can use my iPhone and touch all of my screen while it is in this Red Star Tec band. It is a little stiff in that I feel I need to have definite purpose when pushing a button, so it is not for fast texting, but I understand that if working out and using this band you would be using it for minimal things anyway. I can handle that and overall it's is going to be perfect for me.

The band is just $14.97 on Amazon which is comparable to other bands like this.

It's nice to have options on where to put my phone. As a busy mom, my hands are always occupied so this is the perfect way to keep my hands free but my phone on me for whenever I need it!

I wanted this battery for games like geocaching or Ingress.  At first I was worried about the brand as I'd never heard of Limefuel.  But I found positive reviews for their other products so I figured it was a good price.  I am indeed happy with this product.  The case is a little hard to get onto my phone.  But that's minor.  I ran the battery to 0% and then plugged the phone in to time a full charge.  It took about 4.5 hours.  After that I had a fun night out with friends playing Ingress.  After 7 straight hours of very heavy continuous use of the GPS, LTE data and screen; the battery registered that it still had 49% charge.  That is excellent in my opinion.

It should be plain to people that this battery is heavy.  After all it is 4x bigger than the stock battery.  It didn't take long to get used to the weight though and when I switched back to the stock battery my phone felt feather light.  Downsides of the battery and case are that the speaker is heavily muffled.  You're going to need to crank the volume just to hear ringtones and/or notifications.  It is also a little difficult to get my finger in to open the battery plug cover to plug in the phone.

I would not use this battery for my normal daily use.  I use my phone for tracking my runs and playing music on said runs.  This battery is far too big and heavy for such a use unless I had some sort of sling to hold the phone.  All that aside I would definitely recommend this battery if you're going to need to use your S5 for an extended period away from an available charger.  I imagine it will be much appreciated on my next flight as well.

reviewText:
This review is for the CellEver Note 4 Premium Leather Wallet Case [Flip Folio Cover] with Kickstand and Pockets. The case arrived on time and packaging was very minimal.

Overall the case is well made and the materials used appear to be high quality. My favorite features are the card slots (obviously) and the magnetic closing strap. There is no snap closure here! I only wish this it was magnetic to stay open to the back of the case (for when you want it out of the way).

The case also does not interfere with tempered glass screen protectors and the surrounding TPU protects the phones perimeter and buttons really well. It is not like other phones that leave the top, bottom and buttons exposed. Buttons are still easily pressed and all ports and microphone openings are perfect and centered.

My only negative and reason why I will take 1 star away is because the card pockets go all the way down. If you push a card too far down you will have to try to fish it out. The problem is magnified if this happens to you on the very top pocket and your card goes all the way down. They should have sewn the pockets card size for this not to happen.

Verdict: 4-stars! At $9.99 this a Good Buy. Just fix the pockets issue and possibly add a magnet to the back of the case for strap to stick to it and it becomes a Great Buy.

How my Ratings Work:
1 Star = Awful. Complete junk. Do not buy. Stay far away.
2 Stars = Not good at all, but there are a few redeeming qualities...
3 Stars = It's okay. It's not terrible, but I'm not thrilled with it either.
4 Stars = Fantastic! I love it, but there are a few things that could improve.
5 Stars = This product is wonderful in every way. Buy it! Re-buy it! Worship it!!!

*If at any time my opinion on this product changes, I will update my review to reflect that.
**This product was received either at no or low cost for review, inspection and testing purposes. No compensation for a positive review was provided. All of my reviews are based 100% off of my experience with the product and I never guarantee a positive review.
summary: My favorite features are the card slots (obviously) and the magnetic ...

I've had the Blu Energy X for two weeks now. I have to say it's not the best Blu phone I have had, but it's got its perks.

Pros:
~Good battery. Not the best (I miss my Studio Energy, wanted the Studio Energy 2 but out of my budget) but it gets me from sunup to sundown.
~Android 5.1. Amazing. Great features.
~Seems to me that I can store more apps on my SD card versus other Android phones I've owned.

Cons:
~VERY glitchy. I've had to restart the phone several times because apps would crash and not open.
~It took about seven times to download certain apps.
~1 GB RAM is really not enough to run everything I want.
~Phone is slow to call. I hit call button and it takes several seconds to show that it made the call. Also the phone rings for 5-8 seconds before the screen pops up to let me answer.

I'll be keeping this phone, but as soon as I can I'll be getting the Studio Energy 2.
summary: I have to say it's not the best Blu phone I have had

I just received this today and tried it out. Immediately I could tell the construction of this case is excellent. The leather feels nice, and the added elastic band on the back is a good touch to allow you to slip your hand in and keep grasp of the case/tab.  The Galaxy Tab badge on the side of the case cool. On the inside there's two credit card sized slots for an ID card of a "return to address if lost" tag. And that's about it.

Now with the most important part.  This case, although recommended by Amazon for the Tab 2 7in,  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS FOR  GALAXY TAB 2 7.0 OWNERS! I think it only is compatible for the 1st gen Galaxy Tabs.

The tab doesn't fit correctly; some of the tab is exposed on the left because it doesn't go in all the way. The fabric that holds the tab in doesn't have the correct cut-outs for the Tab 2. The top portion completely covers the mic and headphone jack. The volume button is covered on the upper/high volume portion, thus keeping pressure on the high volume button.  Even though I don't use the Peel app and the IR, it's completely covered as well.  The bottom speakers aren't aligned correctly. And lastly, the light sensor is completely covered also, so if auto brightness is on, will always dim the screen to adjust to low light situations.

Again, this case would be excellent for the original Galaxy Tab 7 first generation, BUT NOT FOR THE GALAXY TAB 2 7.0
summary: Nice case, Not for the Tab 2 7.0"s

reviewText:
This is actually a very good case hampered by a couple of small issues that are a big deal in the way I hold a case. I have had several Seidio cases in the past and this feels similar to them. The kickstand seems to be improved over previous models and does not stick out as far as the 5s model. Also, the kickstand is magnetized which adds a nice touch. Unfortunately the button cutouts on this model are absolutely rubbish. Too much of the phone is exposed for too little/difficult access of the buttons. It just doesn't seem well thought out and you'd think someone along the line would come up with a better option.

My Pros/Cons list for this case:

Pros:
- Looks and feels very nice, feeling only gets better with time in my opinion
- The kickstand is improved over previous versions and I might actually use it more often! Though still a little weak, so long as you take even a modicum of care while opening it, you should be fine.
- The squared off sides and bottom are preferred for me, the way I hold the phone (especially when texting, etc) the squared off bottom is ideal for me!

Cons:
- The buttons are much more difficult to use in this case - This is a big one for me, you have to get your finger in JUST right to hit them, usually putting the phone off balance in the hand. A case is supposed to protect from drops, not cause them.
- The openings on the bottom could cause issues with some headphones and lightning cables. My Bose headphones BARELY fit. The Apple lightning cable fits fine but others probably will not.
- Straight out of the box the case is quite slick. If you have perpetually dry hands like I do this case is slippery. Not quite as slippery as the iPhone 6 itself, but slippery nonetheless. When fiddling with a colleague's case (who's had it a couple of months), this slickness seems to dissipate.
- Slide-on cases scare me. It's probably just me being paranoid, but even the tiniest speck of dirt inside a slider case would make the phone prone to scratching. Slider cases have always scared me for this one reason. Seidio seems to have helped by adding a soft lining to the case.

Overall this case is okay. It's been added to my case repertoire, and we'll see in the future how often and in what situations it's used.
summary: Good case but a couple of issues.

Perfect solution for charging multiple devices in the vehicle or a friend who always needs a quick charge when riding with you. The car charger has three ports to insert your device's USB cord. Two slots are labeled with 2.4A for smart phones or tablets on regular charge of 5V. The other slot is labeled QC 3.0 for a quick charge which is compatible with Qualcomm Quick Charge Technology devices. Both my Samsung Galzxy S6 and Note 4 can use this slot; make sure to check the quick charge device list for compatible devices. If your device if not compatible, it will charge at regular speed. I only have a DC input is under my radio so I like that the charger is small in size and does not stick out too far and be easily bumped. The charger fits snug in the DC input and I tested this because my daughter wants to charge her pad and play with it from the backseat. I am also pleased with the chrome-like finish as it matches with other chrome touches in my Jeep.
summary: Perfect multi-device charger for your car

reviewText:
I like this case quite a bit. It's kind of like having one of those long wallets you see men carrying, or even maybe like a lady's wallet she would keep in her purse. It's definitely a good size, and your phone slides in easily. At first it took some shaking to get it out because it was a little snug, but after some use it loosened up and now it comes in and out nice and smooth. The outside of the case has a little slot for a drivers license, business cards, credit cards, or things of that sort. I wouldn't say you could get much more than three or four cards in there along with the phone. If you were to go without the phone, you could even use the whole thing as a wallet. I wear mine on my hip pocket and am yet to find a way to get the phone out without taking the whole thing off my pocket and flipping it upside down to get the phone out of it. This would be considered a con to most people, but I look at it as I'm either doing that or I'm reaching into my pocket to dig it out anyway. To me, it's technically the same but this way I don't have to worry about my keys scratching the screen or any loose pocket change. The case does feel like a nice leather, it's not one where you would pick it up and think "this is cheaply made", this feels good in the hand and the material inside the pouch kind of helps clean a little bit of the fingerprints off the screen taking it in and out of the pouch. Not a whole lot, but a little. This is a nice pouch because I don't carry much, so it's easy to leave my wallet at home and carry this with me and keep everything together.
I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I got this for my IPhone 5. My children all play some type of sport and I am always taking pictures of them. I love that I can get better shots on my phone with thee clip on lenses. I do not want to spend the money to buy a expensive camera. I love that I can get way better pictures and the extra lenses can fit in my purse. The kit comes in a plastic bag with everything inside of it. The kit includes a microfiber cloth, pouch, the clip to hold the lens while attached to your phone, and the three lenses (once you disconnect the macro and wide lenses). I really like the microfiber cloth being included so as not needing to hunt for one. The basics are pretty simple. Take whichever lens you want to use, screw it into the clip, clip the lens to the phone so it covers the lens of your camera, and start taking pictures. Each type of lens has its strengths, and the names for each are pretty self-evident. As to the macro and wide lenses, you the macro works by itself, but the wide lens needs the macro to work properly. As such, you cannot screw the wide lens in without the macro.  I received a discount on this product in a special promotion. My review, my opinion and experience is honest and 100% genuine.

This is a good, sturdy case, and has protected my phone from many falls on concrete, tile, sand (0/10 do not recommend),  and even into the toilet once. If you're looking for a protective, stylish, and sleek case, you will love this one! The corners are scuffed up, but not glaringly so.

The cutouts are well sized, and the volume and power buttons still have a satisfying "click" to them. The bevel around the camera is deep enough to protect the lens from incidental scratches if you set your phone on a flat surface.

My only gripe is that the ridges get pretty gunky pretty fast and are hard to clean. I also noticed some discoloration to the case early on, and have been unable to restore it to its original color. In my photos can see the difference in color between the exposed case and the silicone under the edge piece. If you are concerned about keeping it clean for sanitary reasons, you might want to skip this one. If you just care about the asthetics, maybe consider a different color.
summary: Great case, hard to keep clean.

This product has given me an extra layer of protection from falls, break and privacy and I would definitely recommend these types of products to everyone.

The Samsung S7 Edge dual sim phone arrived in a factory sealed box and is perfect in every way. I had read some reviews which cast doubt about whether they were new and genuine, but I can assure any other buyers, that mine is the real thing. I commute between two countries and use different carriers in each, so the dual sim phone is perfect. One can receive and make calls and text or use data on one sim or the other and change preference as required. The nice thing is that texts and call logs still appear in sequence whichever sim is used. Other people can call or text on whichever number and you still receive the calls if you wish. As other reviewers have pointed out, it is a shame that Samsung use the expansion memory slot for the second sim, so you cant have both. In the S5 you could have two sims and expansion memory as well.
summary: S7 edge dual sim phone perfect in every way at a great price.

reviewText:
EDIT:
I installed the Marshmallow update several weeks ago, and I've had zero problems with the phone since. It seems to have solved my Bluetooth issues; if anything it's now TOO persistent - the Zenfone Laser won't allow my LG G4 to connect to audio in my car if it's still on. So, install the Marshmallow update, and you'll have a really good, 4 star mid-range phone. Overall, I'm glad I bought it, it's still not quite as good as my LG G4 overall but I paid half as much for it - IMO it's worth more than that.

Original Review:
I got the unlocked 32gb Zenphone 2 Laser with 3gb memory. I wanted a dual SIM solution because T-Mobile has service at my work and AT&T has service everywhere else; unfortunately it's not a seamless solution because of T-Mobiles weird restrictions (no call forwarding? In 2016?). Unfortunately the phone is also crippled by Bluetooth connection problems so severe I've been forced to relegate it to work-only duty; if you want to use car BT connections routinely you will have to look elsewhere.

Pros:
- Screen is bright, clear. Honestly, can't tell it's not 1080p.
- reasonably fast and responsive (3 gb memory version). Plays games like zombies v. plants without a hitch.
- works well with AT&T, T-Mobile.
- memory card slot accepted 128gb card without a hiccup.
- camera is ok, not near as good as my LG G4 but much better than my old iphone 5 and Nexus 4. Nice features in the Zen camera app like HDR and manual controls.
- ZenUI interface not bad, quite usable, fairly light skinning.
- suite of Zen software has some useful tools, easy to disable.
- marshmallow update available (but reported to be buggy, so haven't installed it yet).
- battery lasts all day with light-moderate use.

Cons:
- Bluetooth issues - read around on Reddit about ongoing BT problems with Zenphones. Not a good choice if car BT is essential to you. In one car I own I have to stop and restart BT on the phone to get it to connect (sometimes, not consistently; drops off and on); in the other vehicle I have to turn the whole car off and on.... don't get me started on my BT speaker....
- the replaceable battery is only available as a kit with a charger directly from ASUS; no battery-only or aftermarket battery solutions. So pricey, and with extra baggage.
- speaker is ok but earphone volume is low, usually have to keep it on max volume - but I can listen at 50% on most other phones.
- no Qualcomm quickcharge, takes several hours to recharge from empty with a 2.1A charger.
- gets quite warm with GPS use and when streaming music, not as bad as iphone 5 or Nexus 4 but much worse than LG G4.
- several minor niggles that are mostly me; I don't like the full-time capacitive touch buttons (not upgradeable) or the lack of NFC.

Overall, not a bad phone, but BT issues are a serious problem that could possibly be remedied with a software update; I have no idea why they haven't fixed it yet. I haven't heard they are fixed in Marshmallow; once it's stable I will find out.
summary: Close to excellent - they solved the Bluetooth problems with Marshmallow update.

reviewText:
I've had other precision tool kits, but nothing this complete and compact.  I'm quite happy with the tools included as they are decent enough quality (though not impressive and premium) to fulfill their intended purpose without breaking or performance issues.  The only issues I really have are that some pieces do not easily snap back into place or fall out.  Nothing major, but it's a little bit of a pain to get the suction cup and rolling pry tool back into place and one of the screwdrivers keeps falling out.  Also, it's worth noting that while the color in the listing looks to be a construction yellow, it appears more pinkish orange in person. Full disclosure, I'm red/green color blind, but others agree that the color is not yellow and is pinkish.  Not a problem for me, but a discrepancy nonetheless.  All in all, I would recommend this to anyone working on electronics every once in a while, though a more premium kit might be needed if you were to work on this stuff regularly, but that's just an assumption.

NOTE:  THIS REVIEW WAS MADE IN EXCHANGE FOR A DISCOUNT ON THE PRODUCT.  ALL VIEWS AND OPINIONS ARE HONEST AND MY OWN.
summary: Nice little budget toolkit for working on electronics.

I opted for this Rugged Nylon Belt Clip Holster Pouch Case because my Motorola Droid Turbo is a heavier weight phone and tends to slide out of other belt holsters that are made of high impact plastic. This case does not rotate on it's clip but is perfectly comfortable. I had never heard of this manufacturer before I had a salesperson in a local retail store recommend it for my Nexus 6. Researched the case and it had everything I was looking for. Rugged construction, rubber outer protection, screen protector and a belt clip. Once I received the case I was stunned to see how tightly this case conformed to my phone. Also, it was difficult at first to see how to open the case and put my phone in it but this is a good thing. It means small tolerances in a plastic and rubber case which is sometimes hard to achieve.

Once I got my phone in the case, it is as secure and protected as it would be in an Otterbox case. The other plus side is the price. Regular price for this case is $40. That is $20 cheaper than the Otterbox. I got the case on Amazon for $19.99 which is a score in my opinion for this type of case.

I would recommend this case to anyone who wants to protect their investment in a smartphone.
summary: Great case and cheaper than Otterbox

This is a nice travel charger that will charge four devices simultaneously. It has 4 USB ports and two of them are super powerful ports that will output 5 VDC at 2.4 Amps. That is the power that an Apple iPad Air likes to charge at when it is very low. The other two ports on the wall charger output 5 VDC at 1 Amp and that is ideal for charging your smart phones. The unit has flip out AC wall charger plugs and that is a nice feature if you toss this into a backpack, computer bag, carry-on luggage or just pack it away in a bag or briefcase. In my video I show it charging four items at one time and it worked perfectly while outputting over 5 amps. The unit has a max output of 6 amps. I was charging: * Two iPhone 5S units at 1 Amp each * An iPad Air at 2.04 Amps * A Samsung Tab 4 at .95 Amps The unit will operate on 100 to 240 VAC and 50/60 HZ. It is surge protected to protect it and your devices that are charging. The unit has an LED that is blue and it is on when the unit is plugged into the wall. It is very dim and that is good for me as I don't like bright LEDs in the hotel bedroom or in my bedroom at night. My only minor complaint is that the unit when plugged in covers enough of the other AC wall outlet that you cannot use the other AC wall power outlet. That means you are using one and losing one and in a hotel room that sometimes can be a problem. I still liked the unit a lot and I rated it at 5 stars. I particularly liked the ability to output 2.4 amps for my iPad Air and the ability to charge 4 items. I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation. A review was not promised to the supplier in exchange for the sample but I stated that if I provided a review that it would be fair and honest.
summary: A nice portable travel and home charger for four devices at one time!

There are some negatives though, the Buttons have almost no feedback when pressed, only the power button feels clicky, the volume buttons have absolutely no feedback and when you press the button itself you don't feel like you're pressing a button.
Another thing to mention is that DIGIWAVES U.S.A. was really fast in shipping my product, it only took three days to arrive, overall this case is a solid buy and for the price its well worth it. If they were to revise the case and fix the buttons I would give a complete 5 stars.

reviewText: This is my second charger, I lost, well thought I lost my previous one which was found.  I use this with my S8+ and it charges the phone fast while I'm at work.  Price is good, quality is good.

I've purposely waited to write this review so I can give a post "newness" idea of my experience with this phone.

Let's get to it.

I've had the phone for a little over a month now. After reading many reviews, watching you tube video reviews and unboxings, I decided on the HTC On. The phones I were debating on were the HTC, Samsung Galaxy S4, and iPhone 5S. And, ultimately I was sold on the HTC One.

The good:
1. Build quality. The phone is solid. Made of aluminum and glass, with zero gap construction. There is no creaking or other signs of sub-par construction.

2. The display. The lcd screen produces a beautiful picture with dark darks and bright whites. The display is great.

3. Sound. The much talked about Boom Sound front facing speakers are something that must be experienced. I used to use my headphones to watch You Tube videos even when I was alone and there wasn't a chance of disturbing others. Now I use the sound through the speakers. The sound is phenomenal!

4. HTC Zoe. I won't get to much into this because there is a lot to do in this feature. But, I will say that the built in feature allows the user to create 30 second videos with sound and editing at the push of a button. The end product is totally shareable directly after creation.

5. Speed, storage and battery. The processor being used makes the phone very speedy. There is practically no lag. Switching between screens and tasks is fluid and smooth. The phone has 32gigs of storage which is more than enough for me. I have to say that I don't use my phone as a music player so I don't fill it up with music.  Battery life has been pretty good after I got over the honeymoon stage of always using my phone. I do consider myself a power user, minus gaming, and I get through a twelve hour work day without charging.

6. Size. I believe that HTC has found the "sweet spot" with the size of this phone. Coming from the Samsung Galaxy S3, which I found to be a good size if not a little wide, I think the HTC being a little taller and thinner is a better form factor.  And I feel the size of the screen is better than the more petite iPhone 5S.

And now the Bad;

1. The camera. I mentioned HTC Zoe as a great feature, but the camera used for this feature is kind of bad. The auto focus is spotty and the clarity of the pictures are also hit or miss. I have found that I can stand in the same spot and take the same pictures and get widely varying results. At this price point and quality of product, the camera should be much better.

2. The aluminum body. Here we go again. I know I said the build quality is a plus, and it is a solid feeling phone. I prefer plastic because in my experience while plastic will often scratch when dropped,  aluminum will dent. I think scratches are easier to live with than dents.

And that's it. As you can see. The plusses far out weigh the minuses. Of the two cons the camera is the one that is find to be the most egregious. The competitors at this price point are putting far superior cameras in their products. My wifes iPhone 5S produces pictures that blow the HTC out of the water.

But overall the phone is probably the best smartphone available. I have had the chance to work with the iPhone 5S and the new Samsung Note 3, and i am still sold on the HTC One. And there are rumors of software updates that may help with the camera.

I would give the HTC One 4 1/2 stars. Minus 1/2 for the camera.

reviewText:
Shame on me for not writing this sooner. Here I was, writing a review for another case I recently purchased to house my new iPhone 6 Plus. I was comparing it to this case when I realized I'd never taken the time to mention just how impressed I am with the Pure Gear Extreme Impact.

Although I could say a great many things about this case:
 - Interior rubber cushioning
 - Reinforced corner bumpers
 - Long-time durability

It really comes down to this:
I dropped my phone from about 7' trying to hike up the sleeve of my jacket while getting out of my car in a garage with a concrete floor. The phone sailed out of my hand and landed right on the concrete.

This was 2 years ago and the phone still works perfectly. No cracks, scratches, dents or nicks.

Pros:
 - Tremendously shock resistent
 - Excellent grip (sides and texture of backing)
 - Has provided years of protection for my phone
 - Raised lip on front to protect glass face on impact (with a flat surface)

Cons:
 - They don't make one for the iPhone 6 Plus is this color

This case is amazing! I've used every case from the Otterbox Commuter, Otterbox Defender, Griffin Survivor, Griffin Survivor Slim and Body Glove Shocksuit. This case blows them ALL out of the water.

The green (or other colored) portion of the case is slick which allows for easy fit in and out of the pocket. The black part is textured rubber which allows for a really good grip and also keeps the phone from sliding around. The port covers are large enough to accommodate pretty much every size charger or auxiliary plug. When closed, the port covers are really snug and keep dust, dirt and even some liquid (don't mistake this comment as meaning the case is waterproof. I'm not willing to test that!).

I paired this case with a Tech Armor Ballistic Glass screen protector. This case fits perfectly over the Ballistic Glass and the built in screen protector gives it another layer of protection against my clumsy self. So far I have dropped this case multiple times on concrete, wood, gravel, down stairs (I told ya'll that I'm clumsy!), etc and it still looks brand new with no dings or marks.

You won't be disappointed with this case!

It's an almost invisible and doesn't affect the skin at all. I was really impressed by the feedback on this item so I ordered it for my new Nokia Lumia 635. They arrived the same day. I read the instructions and cleaned the surface of the phone with alcohol, wiped it with the cloth, and then carefully peeled the film backing from the protector and gently applied it to the face of the phone. Bubbles everywhere that I could not work out. So I peeled the film gently away and tried applying again. Still the same problem. I repeated this several times, then put the film backing on the protector, recleaned the surface of the phone, wiped it down with the supplied cloth and then tried again. Still bubbles. I could see bits of dust and tiny fibers inside several of the bubbles. An hour of this and I was frustrated plus by then the adhering surface has apparently picked up more dust. So I read through users suggestions, tried cleaning under warm running water and shaking off, then reapplied to a clean phone. Now not only are there bubbles but also the adhering surface appears smeared. I'm giving up. The product itself would be outstanding if I could get it installed, very smooth and would provide nice protection. Will try something else.
summary: very smooth and would provide nice protection. Will try something else

I bought a bright green case for my 950XL.  It has a good gripping surface on the sides, great protection with the soft inner layer and hard outer case, the bright green color is easy to see from across the room (and I like green anyway!), and the button design actually improves how I am able to use the buttons on the phone.

On the side where the three buttons are close together, the upper volume button and lower volume button each are formed at a slight angle.  So by feeling the three buttons the up volume button is angled up toward the top, the main button is flat, and the down volume button is angled up toward the bottom.  Also the button's material will 'grab' your finger as you move your finger along the right side of the phone.  A clever and very useful design which pretty much eliminates the three-button problem on these phones.

I'd say - Get One!
summary: This Solves the Three-Button Problem on a 950 / 950XL

I have used a few BT headsets in the past from motorola and plantronics. Plantronics have been consitantly better with pairing, sound quality, and overall better construction and are less bulky. The one thing I couldn't stand about this unit is comfort. why they used a thin piece of bare plastic to clip to your ear and call it ergonomic and comfortable is dumb. I am sure many people might be able to tolerate it, but people with big/sensitive/ or atypical ears may suffer from wearing it for more than 5 minutes. it takes about 5mins for me to feel pain from the time I put it on.

conclusion:
I wouldn't say its a bad product, but it sure could have been more comfortable. It hurts my ears, so im sure others will experience discomfort as well. as for build quality, paring, and audio; I think it is excellent in especially for the price. For me I am returning mine to get a clipless BT headset and I will no longer have sore ears =]

reviewText: great disposable, give away cords

First a little background- I'm a phone/ mobile device guy (I used to swap out my phone about every 3-5 months) I've used iPhones, Android variants like Samsung, HTC, LG, Xiaomi, Nexus, even few Nokia / Windows phones.  Features are one thing, but a good customizable user experience is another.  That's probably why in the early Android years I kept going back to the iPhone...but I digress.

As the years passed, I got increasingly tired of carrying around (and packing) a phone, a tablet and (or) an e-reader.  Most phones have just about enough power to last a full day, a tablet is good (with intermittent usage) for a few days; and most e-readers last about 3 weeks to a month.

Who this phone IS for: A person looking to simplify their life with one device.

Here's why:
1. A huge display: 6.1 inches!  (This easily replaces a 7-10" tablet) even if the display resolution is HD 720 x 1280 it's bright and great for reading and watching movies.
2. Battery life: 3900 mAh battery.  With normal daily usage (reading emails, text messages, social media, and news feeds) I average about 3 days between charges. (That replaces the e-reader) and now images and illustrations in my ebooks are in color!
3. Storage: The micro SD card slot can support up to 128GB!  That's a lot of music, movies or travel pics.

Who this phone is NOT for: Power gamers, skinny-jean wearing hipsters, or folks looking to shoot award-winning Instagram pics.  The camera is great as far as I'm concerned.  I use it for capturing family memories and documenting stuff I take apart & repair.

Hope that helps make your purchasing decision a little easier.
summary: A year later and I still love this phone!

It does NOT presently support voice over wifi
The stock launcher does not have an app drawer
The phone ships encrypted. You cannot disable it with stock config

Hands-down one of the best conceived monopods on the market. Has a simple and easy style to it. The packaging it came in is excellent and encompasses all the necessary goodies to get started. Included is the Monopod/ Selfie Unit, Hand Strap, Charging Cable and Documentation, and of course (the always there though you can't see it) Anker's 18 month warranty coverage on the unit.

Very good weigh to extended-length ratio enhanced by a well designed ergonomic hand grid and Handstrap support. This is indeed a very compact unit too; no longer than a standard 7"-8" tablet (my reference was a first gen Nexus 7).

This is the first monopod product that I've come across that has 95% 5-star reviews with the remaining 5% with 4-stars and this is out of a total reviewership of 55 (at the time of this review).

There are so many generic haphazard looking monopods on the market now, but as with everything I currently own I prefer the quality and assurance that can be offered by a known company such as Anker anytime, any-day. Remember folks, 95% Positive Feedback and 18 months warranty goes a long way.

2. The second device - the Galaxy S2 - worked beautifully for about two months until last night when it upped and died. Stone cold dead. So now I am waiting for the warranty replacement to be shipped to me by Samsung (at my expense?).

These are absolutely brilliant devices, but for this consumer they fail 100% of the time thus far.

I received this product at a reduced rate for my honest opinion and review of this product.  I started using this product right after I received it.  At first I wasn't sure about it until I got it on my phone.  I was a little concerned about the protection of my screen.  Then I realized that the front overlapped and covered enough of the screen to fully protect the face if I was to accidently drop it (which I do quite often), so my mind was at ease.  The case is actually so much more durable than the more expensive case I had prior that was coming apart.  The only issue I've had, and it was a small issue once I figured out how to solve the problem, was when I would adjust the volume the Volume status would stay on the screen of my phone and wouldn't go away.  I finally realized that the case was very tight, so once I "relieved" the button on the side of the phone by pushing the case out some the volume status disappeared.  I guess it was so tight it was holding the button in.  Needless to say relieving it the one time has fixed the issue and it hasn't been a problem since.  I love this phone case!  Thank you for giving me the opportunity to rate and review it for your company!  A++++  Rating!!!

reviewText:
I have used a lot of glass protectors...I end up cracking them somehow.  But, they do the job and protect my screen!  This amFilm two pack- wow!!!  I have paid a lot for some of my screen protectors...this one was a today's deal.  OMG - it was the easiest out of all of them to apply!
They tell you to thoroughly wash your hands (they all do) to remove oils.  Then they provide the wet wipe (they all do) and then a dry wipe (!!!!!this is a first).  I always fight the dust particles..and haven't won.  Today, SUCCESS.  Not only that, they tell you to pull the tab to remove the film and then they have provided a tab on each end to hold the protector over the phone/tablet and center - then set it on....I watched it slowly apply getting all the air out with absolutely no dust!  Too freaking easy!!!! AND I have a spare since it was a two pack!  WIN!

reviewText:
After a week with the IMP100P, I definitely feel like I have a good handle on the device's capabilities.

I really like the look and feel of the IMP100P. It's sleek, glossy shell looks good next to the many devices I've set next to it.

Operation is simple, with the single power button and a series of leds to display the charge status. I think it's a nice touch that if you look closely at the leds they're actually labeled "full," etc.

For the last week I've used the IMP100P as my primary charger for my Nexus 7 and Samsung Galaxy S3. With the two usb ports I was able to charge both devices at the same time. Charging is quick, even when using both usb ports simultaneously. The unit is more reliable than charging via the cigarette lighter in my car.

My only issue with this device is the special cable required to charge it. It's frustrating to have to carry a proprietary cable that isn't good for anything other than charging the IMP. This device would be near perfect if it allowed charging via micro sub like most other modern electronics. Then with a single cable you could charge your phone, charge the IMP, and charge the phone from the IMP.

I also continue to hope that New Trent will make a "tough" edition of one of their chargers. A lot of my charging use is while camping, hunting, and fishing. It would be great to not have to worry about moisture and dirt.
summary: Tons of power, great device, wish it were easier to charge

reviewText:
Well, I thought this was a great deal. I just figured out today several months later that I got a fake.

Its a really good fake, but the big give away is the lack of a water indicator sticker on top of the battery.

If you don't have that little water indicator sticker that they use to void the warranty if you drop it in water, then its not real. The sticker is on the top of the battery next to the charging pins. No pink and white XXX sticker (or all white apparently), then you got a fake too.

So my battery says EB-BG900BBE 2800 mAh on the back.
S/N: AA1F411HS/2-B

Also, I didn't get the wall charger or cable that supposedly come in the box with the fake one, the real one has the wall charger.  See photos.

I bought this from Amazon and fulfilled by Amazon Prime so you would expect that I would have gotten the real thing.

Nope! Got a fake, granted its a really nice looking fake but the battery doesn't last nearly as long.

I informed Amazon, lets see if they do anything about it.

Update #1: Amazon is sending me a replacement battery kit in exchange for the counterfeit one. They were really cool about everything even though it was out of the return period.

Update #2: The replacement arrived from Amazon and it looks just like the first kit. Came in one box and there is no hologram on the box. Also the box is not large enough to hold a wall charger so I am assuming its not in there. I didn't open the replacement box because there wasn't much point. It was the same.

Update #3: After speaking with a customer service representative at Amazon, they gave me a return label for both battery kits and I sent them back. I have also gotten a credit on my card for the purchase.

I went ahead and ordered the kit direct from Samsung. Comparing the two they are so extremely close in just about every way in appearance. I am rather surprised how good the fake ones look. The replacement battery has the little white water detection sticker, the fake one does not.

Also, the official kit comes with a little black wall charger so you can charge your phone and the battery pack at the same time. Honestly, other than the lack of a water damage indicator sticker on the battery and the lack of a wall charger, I honestly don't think I would have noticed. Boxes were completely different though, so double check it before you buy it.

The fake battery swelled up after a few months and the case wouldn't fit on the phone with it anymore.

Here is the link direct to Samsung. http://www.samsung.com/us/mobile/cell-phones-accessories/EB-KG900BWUSTA

Attached are some photos.  In all the photos the real thing is on the LEFT, fake battery kit is on the RIGHT.

Also, I took a picture of everything included in the real kit.

Just look at the pictures of the boxes and you will know if you have a real one or not.  Got to have that Hologram!
summary: Did you buy a FAKE?  Check out my photos!

Video Review Summary: The Joyiqi Portable Rechargeable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker makes a really good portable speaker and here's why. The speaker offers up lots of options to make it very personal and can go just about anywhere. The sound is really great and impressive for the size. The speaker features buttons for Volume +/-, Skip forward/backward, Play/pause, and a multi-function button. There are three main ways to use this device for music: using an optional Micro-SD card pre-loaded with music, Bluetooth connection, or for music players that don't feature Bluetooth, a 3.5mm AUX-in port. The micro-SD card route is perfect if you intend to use this with a bike. It is important to note here that the speaker is not designed for call answering as it does not feature a microphone. The package has all the accessories one could possibly need and you are all setup out of the box. Included in the box: the Joyiqi Bluetooth speaker, four skins (black, blue, red, green), an optional wrist strap, four color matching rubber straps for attaching the speaker to a pole or bike handle, one USB charging cable, and a 3.5mm AUX connection cable. The Joyiqi performs very well and does an excellent job reproducing music. In the video, I play some music from the YouTube Audio Library (royalty/copyright-free) which will help you get a better feel for what this speaker sounds like. The bass on this unit is very respectable. The speaker is ultra-portable and the added ability to customize its look is very cool. Generally, the Joyiqi Portable Rechargeable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker is a great performer and delivers lots of options for use for the end user. [Sample Provided For Review]
summary: Really Nice Portable Speaker With Lots Of Customization Options...

reviewText:
Initial review: I received this quickly, plugged it in, and am happy to say that it works fine so far with my iPhone 6. Having a power switch is a very valuable addition to prevent your battery from draining if you don't ride your bike for extended periods.

Notably, I bought this after buying two Battery Tender SAE to USB adapters (http://www.amazon.com/Battery-Tender-081-0158-Disconnect-Charger/dp/B00DJ5KEF4/), each of which failed after just a couple of weeks. Let's hope that this lasts for longer. I'll post an update after I've lived with it for a while. To make a clean-looking installation, I simply used black wire ties to a nearby cable.

By the way: you should NEVER connect any devices to your bike battery without a fuse in the line. This product on Amazon (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000NCOKZQ) is a good choice.

========

UPDATE (as promised). I really wanted this work, but it failed after two weeks of use - no better than the BatteryTender. No power is delivered to the USB port anymore. This unit has not been abused, or exposed to the elements. I see that "Abegail" has commented below that they will stand by the product. I cannot find a contact, however, to whom I should address my problem.
Everything was ok. :)

What I really like is the off device features that Microsoft put you through.  I wasn't crazy about having to set up another account just for him, but they make up for it with things like find my phone (which I tried and it found it w/I 100 feet).  Setup of game ratings and purchase options, down to the idea that he can ask to have a game or app, I get notified of the request and can deny or accept from another device altogether.  I like that. I love this portable charger so much!  I also have the 20100. This does charge things very quickly (especially with the anker usb to micro usb cable) and is much more portable than the bigger model. This battery charger is awesome. Possibly a little overkill for day to day use, but I anticipate eventually using it for going camping as well, where the longevity of the charge will come in handy. I say that it's overkill for day to day given that it's a 22000mAh battery, and that it's pretty weighty to keep in a purse or backpack. However, many a time myself or my friends have had dying phones and I've been able to come to the rescue. It's also very durable, as I had it with me one night going out with friends and managed to drop it on the sidewalk. It only sustained a small chip in the plastic on the outside and still performs magnificently. Definitely recommend if you're looking for a really durable and long lasting charge with your portable battery. Otherwise, if you don't think you'll wind up needing the longevity of the battery charge and don't want to deal with the weight on a daily basis, I would recommend going with a smaller and lighter model, which may need more frequent re-charging, but won't be as cumbersome to lug around.

I live in the back of a valley, surrounded by mountains, and my drive into town takes me through a tunnel in those mountains.  While my cell signal is good most of the time, it usually drops off in the tunnel, and sometimes on the road passing through the mountains  I got this to prevent lost signal, dropped calls during those times.

It was very easy to set up, took less than 5 minutes all told.  All that is involved is attaching the external antenna with an (included) magnet, the internal antenna with velcro, plugging the box into the lighter socket and attaching the antennas.  They suggest running the wire from the external antenna under the rubber seal on the window, and a  coupon for professional installation is included if you do not think you can do it, or want a different set up.  I actually like the less formal set up as it is easy to bring inside (to prevent theft).  Wires tend to attract unwanted attention.

WeBoost says that the booster has been approved by most major carrier but suggests that you get consent before using it.  I called my cell carrier and my request was met with a shrug (they are not bothered by it at all).  If you have any concerns,call your carrier first.  Installation should not give anyone pause.  For one, it is VERY easy, and for another, you have a coupon for professional installation as a back up.

We tested it, and got 5 bars in the back of the valley. I couldn't ask for more.

We do not have a problem with signal in our house, but this can be used in a house with the addition of a 12 volt DC adapter, though WeBoost cautions that it may interfere with other wireless signals in your home.

It's a pretty great device; easy to install, powerfull and flexible.
summary: Easy to install, powerful signal booster.

The Eloven Ultra Slim 3 Color iPhone case is a nice, above average case. The back of the case is made of semi-rigid plastic. The design helps me to keep a grip on the phone.  The edges are made of a harder plastic and the colors alternate around the edge. All of the openings line up correctly with my phone. There are two holes on the bottom left of the case which are supposed to be used to attach a strap (not included) , but I searched high and low and could find nothing that would work - Seriously, these holes are TINY.

I purchased this battery with money I earned myself. My dignity is not for sale. 4.5 stars. Excellent Qualcomm _Certified_ (contacted CHOE to confirm) QC2 device. That's the blue port. Decent black port: 5V/1.5A. Detracted one star. Can RECEIVE CHARGE via QC2 mains charger: plus half star. No other QC2 portable battery claims capability of being charged via QC2. Additionally it can be charged via [Intel] "Apple" Lightning. A green led illuminates to indicate QC2 output OR QC2 input which is otherwise blue when powered/powering. Using asin B00J3JSEG6, a DROK USB power meter, and confirming with a PortaPow model no longer sold (seller=A3M1K9LXDRB6PN): QC 2.0 port performs at 5V & 9V: both at expected amperages. I have not yet confirmed operation at 12V. DROK is capable at Voltages up to 15 according to the manufacturer (via port II). The CHOETECH non-QC port charges 5V slightly less than 1A. I am using a QC 2.0 capable snapdragon chipset phone: Samsung Galaxy Note 4 Developer Edition (verizon). This is not the issue. The non-QC port is. The CHOETECH non-QC port continues UP to 5V/1.2A for these high draw devices: Samsung Galaxy S5 Developer Edition, Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.1. Using mains power asin B00P933OJC, Anker PowerIQ ports: Note 4 receives more than 0.5 amps _more_ power than CHOETECH non-QC port, Tab S receives more power, S5 receives more power. using both the included USB charge cable and two other QC2 rated cables, asin B00SUY0NCI (Anker), and asin B00VIJN0CM Please refer to the included instructions in your own product; notice the conflict between amazon description and printed instructions. Conflict: amazon claim: 5V/2.4A instructions claim: 5V/1A max measured: 5V/1.26A I have contacted CHOETECH regarding this. They indicate they will update product description and shipping material. I would greatly prefer to have the model as described on amazon. I bought two. I shall be keeping one while on the lookout for one closer to the original description.
summary: not as described QC2 + 5V/1.5A (NOT 5V/2.4A) ; Qualcomm Certified QC2

A con is that the micro USB connection is a bit loose and tends to unplug easily. Fixed with duct tape. You could probably glue the cable on for a more permanent solution.  All in all, worth it if you like having a spare battery,  or like/need to have your phone to use while the other battery is charging.

reviewText: I have just started using my Opteka BP-SC4000 solar charger.  Went to a party my phone was at 30% and needed it for pictures, video, etc. Couldn't sit in car charging it so I had pre-charged my Opteka and used it. Within an hour has doubled my phone battery to 60%!  I was pleased.  I notice that it doesn't charge very fast on sunlight, even direct sunlight, but I only left it in sunlight for about 2-3 hours before attempting to use it again.  I can say that if you pre-charge it using a USB instead, it charges up well.  Sunlight would be more of a last resort type of thing I believe.  The tips that a few others have posted about usage, functionality were great as the directions that come with the device are useless.  It comes with a great selection of charging plugs including the Apple lightning connector, so you're covered.  Felt I got a good deal overall!
summary: Charges slow on sunlight, but charges phone fast!

reviewText: It was a great gift

I tried this out with my phone for the past week and here are my thoughts.
The case has fairly nice feel for it and doesnt come off as the usual glossy plastic that is common for cheap phone cases. It also is firm and doesnt bend under pressure. They made the case accouting for aesthetics and heavy duty protection which is always great. The case is aimed towards people who want protection for their phone and is heavy duty but also light as well as being a shock proof case. The case also hasn't come off on the few occasions Ive dropped by phone with it on which is great, meaning it should sturdy in the inopportune case that I actually drop the phone. The case itself is actually difficult to remove from your phone. The finish sometimes tracks dirt or smudges but that comes off very easily with a simple wipe of a cleaning cloth or similar fabric. That said it does the job of a slim semi-light weight case but heavy-duty protection well. It adds some  weight to the overall phone, and the weight change is noticeable but I isn't a burden. It will protect the backside of your phone from scratches and the cutouts for buttons have no problem and provide access to all buttons on your phone. The finish of the phone also provides for much more grip than the regular phones finish, and will come in handy for people who have problems with dropping their phone or it slipping out of their hands on a regular basis.

Very pleased with this product.

Although a car battery can provide plenty of DC power to run electronic devices, it's at 12 Volts, and most small devices like smartphones and music players take 5 Volts. You can use an inverter, which turns your 12 Volts DC into 110 Volts AC, and then use your normal wall wart adapter to take the voltage down to 5 Volts DC. Or you can use this, and save all the power that would heat up your inverter and wall wart.

I don't know what is inside this device, but it seems to be fairly efficient. It puts out up to 2.1 amps, which at 5 Volts means it can deliver 11 Watts. If you use the 2 amp port, it does get a little warm, but I'll bet the efficiency is up near 90%. Although the charger has two ports, it can only deliver a maximum of 2.1 amps, so you do have a limit on how much charge it can deliver.

New cars seem to have charging ports like this built in. But for those of us with older cars, this is a handy device. It looks well-made, and although not particularly breath-taking in its appearance, it does its job well. Can't ask for more from a charger.

Note that the charger comes with no cord or anything other than what you see in the product picture.

I frequently travel on business internationally and always carry a couple of adapters on me. Inevitably one or more of my colleagues travelling with me don't have adapters for their laptops. I'm often confused how they think they are going to plug into a foreign socket so I'm frequently loaning out my adapters... but I digress.

What I like about this adapter is the universality. It not only adapts to foreign sockets but will also take multiple foreign plug appliances. So if I buy something in the UK and take it to France I can still plug it in. And you never know when you have to purchase a new brick for the laptop because I've left one behind accidentally. So having the ability to accommodate foreign plugs and sockets is just what I need.

In addition it does provide a plastic ground plug for the UK socket because some will not allow you to plug in without the ground.
summary: Great plug adapter for both plugs and sockets

reviewText: Great!

I've bought bluetooth headsets from many different manufacturers, and Plantronics seem to be the best ones for their pricing. I absolutely love this model and the c330, and I'm sure I will purchase a few more of each of them.
The pros for this headset:
-its inexpensive but not built cheaply
-it is easy to operate
-good for approx 500 recharges
-very easy to pair with multiple phones
-very secure fit
-decent volume range
-decent noise canceling
-can take a pretty good beating before it breaks
-stays paired and connected much better than many top-dollar headsets

the cons:
-takes some getting used to the ear nub
-does not handle getting wet very well (but its not meant to for that matter)

reviewText: The Power bank 7800 mah battery backup  from Sentey is like a portable power plant that allows you to charge your devices on the go. Its dual USB charging ports output and can charge two devices at the same time. It also has a handy light that can be used.  The Power bank has an easy access touch button to power it on or long press button to turn on and off the light.  This is a very impressive portable charger. Charged and ready to go right out of the package, the Power bank is ready for use as soon as you get it. And with its small size and has a great black matte design, you can place your Power bank in a bag or purse for easy access charging everywhere you go. This device will keep you charged up around the clock. Stay charged with the Power bank and never have to worry again about running out of power. I would use this speaker exclusively, but when someone else is in the car, especially a child, it becomes impractical.  First, everyone has to listen to the conversation, and second, the radio needs to be turned down, which raises loud objections from my son.  So, I use a headset when I am not alone in the car and use a speaker when I am by myself.

This is a handy gadget to have in your car, pocket, purse, etc. as it's essentially an external battery that you can charge up and have handy in order to then recharge your mobile or other device. This is especially great if you have a mobile like mine that runs out about half way through the day when it's heavily used. In the past I've always just tried to give my phone an extra fill in the car, but often it's not plugged in there long enough to recharge to the level I need, or I'm not somewhere that's feasible to access my car and so my mobile battery begins to run out mid day. Having this device is such a convenience as I don't have to worry so much about trying to conserve use of my phone as I can easily recharge my phone on the fly, wherever I'm at, with no worries.

I've never been one to carry a wall charger in my purse in order to plug my phone in during meetings as I often see others do, and the hassle with that is you always have to find a wall plug and you're tied down to your now corded phone. Folks who do that would absolutely benefit from this instead, as you can then easily charge up wherever you are. I think the biggest challenge is remembering to recharge this so it doesn't go empty. As another stated, it would be great if there was a way to tell how much charge is left in it, but if you can get a general idea of how many charges you get before it needs a refill you can just use that info to charge it regularly after so many recharges it's given to your phone or other device.
summary: Great device for those of us who's smartphone batteries poop out half way through the day...

reviewText:
This review is NOT for the RP-WCN12 Qi charger. Amazon seems to have commingled reviews for that product with those for the RP-WCN14 Qi car charger, the subject of this review. Some of the comments in the negative reviews are for the RP-WCN12 and do not apply to the RP-WCN14. For example, the RP-WCN14 does have a detachable USB cable, apparently a negative point for the RP-WCN12.

So let's get to the car charger. I comes with a dash mount, with a suction base with a sticky material on the bottom. Attached to a flat surface, like the dashboard, it is not going anywhere. I had it mounted for days and it was still very hard to remove it. It also comes with another mechanism for mounting the charger into a vent in the car. While it is a little tricky to figure out, it also works quite well. The charging cradle itself has a slot on the back, and both of the mounts have a ball joint attachment that locks into the slot. The ball joints can be loosened to adjust the cradle (and the phone clamped into it) to any position. The charging cradle has a button to open the clamping mechanism so the phone can be placed, and then you squeeze to quickly clamp the phone into the cradle.

I like to use my phone, a Nexus 5, in the landscape mode as a GPS. This device is perfect for holding the phone in the right position and charging it at the same time. I should add that the charger works fine with my Nexus 5 in a Spigen TPU case and also in a Acase soft silicone/polycarbonate hybrid case, so no need to remove the phone from the case.

Is this a quantum leap from the typical car mount and USB car charger setup? No, but it is a bigger improvement than I thought it would be. The biggest advantage is that there is no more need to find the USB cable attached to the conventional car charger, and then plug it into the phone. You simply pop the phone into the Qi mount and go. My wife is envious because her phone doesn't have the capability to use this RAVPower charger.

As you expect from RAVPower the charger is well designed, and has a quality feel to it. The cost is quite reasonable given that you get two types of mounts and a Qi charger. The mounts alone would cost almost as much.
summary: Slick car charger with flexible mounting if you have a Qi capable phone.

reviewText:
This is a great screen protector for my Sony SW2. The protectors are also completely clear and have not interfered with my touchscreen use over the last month of using them. When you align it the correct direction, it's also a perfect fit (the dimensions are very similar vertically and horizontally, so if you misaligned it, the fit is still pretty great). The protectors also work; I had a piece of furniture I was assembling scratch into my watch face when it slipped free of where it belonged and the protector kept my watch scratch-free. The pack comes with everything that you need to install a protector.

A few quick installation tips: (1) make sure you carefully clean the area around the watch, carefully and *completely* clean the watch face (don't leave any little bits of dust along the edges), and brush off the screen protector itself; (2) before removing the protective covering on the protector and after cleaning everything off, line up the protector; (3) don't touch the sticky side of the protector at all (if possible), or you'll risk leaving a finger smudge; and (4) follow the instructions and start from the bottom or top, don't just drop it on the watch.

If you don't do all of the above, you risk wasting a protector on your first install.  But, the pack does come with three, so that's not a big deal.

I highly recommend these protectors. They're great.
summary: Great fit + great protection + great price = Great protector

Also, it may be useful to know, the base plate is 1 3/4" width x 1 3/8" height x 1/8" thick (metal plate is 1/16" + adhesive layer is 1/16") I would buy more as needed for other small items that need a secure hold or need a lanyard attached to it (e.g. small camera, light meter, etc.) .  Highly recommended.

reviewText:
I bought this phone to use with a shared mobile plan AT&T account.  Not the go phone account.  I don't know anything about go phone service or activation.  Worked perfectly...installed my sim card and started up.  The network recognized my sim and registered the phone on AT&T's network.

Screen Clarity: I would rate very good, not great.  Its slightly less sharp than my MotoG (which had a great screen), but for being a mid range to low/mid range phone it is very good.  Screen backgrounds look sharp and colors are accurate. Text is clear and easy to read.

Speed: Very fast.  Menus are as quick to move thru as my Nexus 4 and MotoG.  I have never experienced any lag.

Build Quality: The phone feels solid.  Light, but not cheap.  My wife and I like the different colors for the back covers (sold separately).  The build joints are better than my old Galaxy S3 (if that's saying much).  It's all plastic, but well put together.  I think the screen is Gorilla Glass 3.  Seems solid.....no scratches after using for a week.

OS:  To my understanding this is one of the first Windows 8.1 devices out.  I like the windows 8.1 OS.  I've used them all.....and it has to be one of the easiest phones I've ever used. The App Store does not have near the amount of apps as Android and iPhone, but all the basic apps I use are there.

If your looking for a no-contract alternative, good all around phone for email, light web browsing, texting and phone calls this is a good phone.  Battery life is good.  It lasts me a regular day.

I cannot talk about the camera......I never use them on phones.  There is no front facing camera on this phone so if you need a front camera I'd look elsewhere.

I love the Nokia music service.  It's free and is basically a Pandora type of service.  You can select the sort of music you like and it plays a playlist of those songs.  The app is already installed and works by opening the app (no registration that I can remember).

Overall a good basic phone.

reviewText: great item to buy with great shipping.

By the previous reviews, I was looking forward to getting a great case.  Unfortunately, that did not happen.

First off, the softer portion of the case is molded terribly.  There are small flaps of the rubber material hanging off at all of the corners of the phone, making it look unfinished.  I suppose I could use an Xacto knife to cut them off, but the point is every cheap rubber case I've ever purchased for any of my cell phones never had this problem.

The back of the Incredible 2 has 3 holes for microphones and the noise cancel, yet the case has no provision for them.  Some have reviewed that it doesn't cause a problem, but it does for mine.  With the case on, voices sound muffled or echoed.  With the case off, voices are loud and clear.

This case does come with a clear screen protector, a cleaning cloth, and a card to help apply the screen protector.  While this was an unexpected bonus, don't get your hopes up.  The protector is not even remotely close to fitting the screen.  It is not wide enough and the corners don't match the shape of the phone.  There is a cutout for the front facing camera, but even that doesn't look to match up properly.  It honestly looks like someone "eyeballed" the phone and then cut the screen protector out by hand.

Sadly, this case will be returned to Amazon.

I have a good friend who lives in the Pocono Mountains area of Pennsylvania who I visit at least every six to eight weeks.  When I had Sprint as my cell phone carrier, the signal at his house was barely there.  Last year I switched to AT & T, and since I did, I cannot pick up a signal anywhere near his mountain getaway.  So when Amazon offered me the weBoost Drive Sleek Cell Phone Booster for my car I was anxious to try it.

The installation was not difficult, but I didn't like having all the wires all over my car.  The actual booster sits in the back seat and the cradle goes on the dashboard.  I figured what the heck  if it improves my signal I can install it and uninstall it each time I visit him, typically for weekend every few months.

I am sorry to report that the improvement in my signal was marginal.  At least I am now able to make a call from my parked car, but I really am not happy with all the wires.  And the improvement was not that great.  I just got back from a two day visit and my bars went from none to two.  Thats it.  In the end, I decided having all those wires all over my car just is not worth it.  Not recommended.
summary: Wires, Wires Everywhere and Not Much Improvement

reviewText:
I am really happy with this outlet! It works perfectly for where I installed it. Since we bought several Echo Dot devices I have been adding smart plugs and using them to voice control lights and run timers for things. I really like this hardwired outlet over the plug in type I have bought previously.

- It is much nicer to look at versus a big bulky wifi plug. (more wife-approved)
- There is no huge branding across the front. Much appreciated. Thanks!
- The Alexa voice control features respond quickly.
- I like that it has a manual button we can use if we want to.

The only thing I noticed that may be an issue is there is no place to land a second set of wires. Most outlet boxes have a romex cable coming into the box and a second cable going out to the next outlet. If that is the case where this is being installed , a pigtail would need to be used to connect this outlet to the second set of wires. In my case, I only had one cable to connect, but I know this isn't the case in the majority of my outlet boxes.
summary: Much better looking option for smart outlet control.

This is a great little case. It's thin and flexible, but still seems to protect my phone really well. As you can see in the video, the case comes in two pieces that are disassembled when installing on the phone. The first layer is a rubber sleeve that covers the sides and back of the phone to protect it from shock and scratch damage. The second piece is the hard plastic outside layer that protects the phone from impact damage on the back and sides. You can see in the video that the case was easy to install and seems to hold my phone securely. I really like the kickstand on the back of the case. It's great for setting my phone down at an angle to watch a movie or simple to have it at a convenient angle while sitting at my desk. My only suggestion would be that it be designed to work with either portrait or landscape (this model only works if your phone is sideways in landscape mode). I did receive a discount to review this item, but I am very pleased with both the quality and the ease of installation. I think you will be too!

reviewText:
Wasn't sure how I was going to like this mount as I like a more "minimalist" design.  But the reviews were positive so I opted to give it a try.  Turns out I love it.  Pros:
1. The suction cup for the windshield works great
2. The arm from the cup to the cradle, while long, is perfect to get my phone up close where I can use it when I need to (mostly I use WAZE for navigation).  The arm is also flexible, so you can mold it to the curve you want, but also incredibly solid, so there is no wiggling or vibrating when you are driving around.
3.  The cradle itself is very well designed and it is extremely easy to get my iphone 6 in and out of it.  Press a button on the back and it opens.  Squeeze the arms on the sides and it snugs down.  There is also a cutout for the charging cord, so it doesn't get caught up in the mount.
4.  The little support under the arm is also genius.  It is small and unobtrusive, but if you bend the arm properly this support keeps the whole system stable.

No cons I can think of.  I will probably get another of these for our other car.
summary: Very well designed and functional in all aspects
