I bought this case for my daughter to serve the purpose of protecting her new phone. And its purpose it has served. The product arrived in a timely manner and was in perfect condition. It is a very good buy for the price. Thanks.

I see some reviews that this doesn't fit well.  I disagree.  Yes, it does not cover 100% of the glass surface of the screen, but it does cover the entire ACTIVE area of the screen (i.e., if applied properly, it covers 100% of the screen pixels that actually light up).  There are two small uncovered glass portions on each vertical edge of the screen that do not get covered by the protector.  But there's a reason for that.  Due to the nature of the screen and the curvature of the phone, static cling screen protectors do not actually fully adhere to those edges of the glass.  So the way this protector is designed is actually ideal--it covers the entire active area of the display, but is small enough that it also fully adheres to the screen and does not have bubbles around the edges.

I've tried several screen protectors for the Droid Mini.  And, objectively (when you understand the reasons for the design choices), this one is the best.

I purchased the 40W unit and could not be happier.  The presentation of the product is near Apple presentation.  Nice box and Sleeve and it is pretty apparent that this is a quality product.  Having said that it seems that purchasers who own the 25W watt unit are not as happy as those who purchased the 40 watt unit.  The 25 watt unit requires specific ports for different devices. iOS, Android, Samsung, etc.  There is an explanation next to the USB ports on the front, and a output chart on the back of the unit where the AC plug is attached.  This is not the case with the 40 watt charger.

There are no diagrams and/or charts on the black charger.  The only print on the black charger is the brand name and the S/N sticker.  The output diagram on the bottom of the unit state that a single port can deliver up to 8 amps.  This is regulated by the demand of the device plugged into the USB port.  Each USB is microchip so there is no danger of overcharging or under charging the device plugged into the charger.

Anker call the microchip ports "SMART PORTS" on the 40 watt unit.  Basically you can plug any device into any USB port in any combination(s) because the ports are not hard wired for specific types of electronic devices.  That is what is stated in the clear instructions and it is working out just great.

I have not used the 25 watt unit but I guess to preserve your sanity, if charging more than one device I would spring the couple extra $$ for the 40 watt unit.  Currently there is a $6 difference between the two unit's prices.  I am very happy with the unit and would buy it again in a heartbeat.  If there is one thing I would like to see on a future improvement it would be a LED on the charger to indicate that it is receiving AC power but this is just a small observation and certainly no show stopper.

Update:

It has just come to my attention while viewing this charger on Amazon that the white version is available in both the 25W and 40W variety.  I had previously missed this, or the white version just became available.  Therefore if the black version is sold out, which at the moment it is then feel free to order the white version if you have no preference on colors
summary: Awesome Charger.  I Am Really Happy With This Purchase.  I recommend The 40 watt unit

These Bastex Micro USB cables are durable, and also come in some vibrant colors. I deemed the six pack worthy of my eyes and it allowed me to put a cable everywhere I've needed one in the past, and have a spare for my room. Not only are they 6 feet long, which is double the standard cable, they are braided. Working in retail, I sell many more braided cables than regular ones, as the braided ones tend to last longer. With the rope like consistency, this allows you to bend and twist a little more, without the worry of it shorting out very quickly. The strain relief on these cables is also very convenient and wide, so it seems like it will hold up longer due to that as well.

reviewText:
I am disappointed with this unit. First of all the buttons are placed in such a way that you are constantly hanging up on people when you are adjusting the headset in your ear.

Audio is terrible in regular mode (hearing other people). It works great in Noise Assassin mode but that mode drains battery power quickly and has to be turned on every time you use it.

Then there is the problem with getting the unit close to your cheek so that the noise cancellation can work correctly. It is a real pain. If your beard is slightly growing in, forget it. It will not work.

The size of the unit was good. The fit in my ear was not that great and hurt my ear after a while. They should have included Jabra ear gels.

While this unit has good technology behind it, the design needs work.
summary: Noise cancelling was good but sound quality was terrible in regular mode...

I purchased this armband to replace one that wore out after lots of use. I read the reviews and usually do quite a bit of research prior to almost any purchase on Amazon. It arrived quickly and packaged well. I put it to use right away. I used it about 10 times, I do wear it pretty snug and it tore at a seam. I might have put too much stress on it but either way, I remembered recently receiving an email from the company asking if I was happy with my product? Perfect opportunity. They also mention that they offer a warranty. It is not an expensive item so I thought, it's worth a picture and an email. If it doesn't work, I'm not out much. Sent one off and received a reply right away with an apology and a promise to send a replacement right away, no need to return mine. It arrived as promised and a month later with the same snug use, it is fantastic. I think I just had a lemon. It's a great armband, the Velcro holds well and I can use the touchpad on my phone without any trouble. I'm a happy customer.

reviewText:
I have two of these - one in my wife's Passat and the other in my Tundra Limited truck.  Great operation with my wife's and my iPhones as well as my Moto Razr phone.  Pairing is a piece of cake and the feature of the phone re-pairing after being turned on works flawlessly.  The battery saving feature where it shuts off automatically also works great.

This product would be 5 stars in my book if the volume was louder.  Note that volume *level* is controlled by either the phone or the unit, but the volume *output* is limited by the unit' amp and speaker.  For all but the absolute quietest situations, the volume is simply not loud enough for reliable use in a car.  Even sitting on my desk as a speakerphone, the volume is insufficient if there is any level of background noise.

Noise canceling and sound quality (from my callers' perspective) is very good, but unfortunately, both of these units were a waste of my money because they are really only barely usable in a car setting.  Both my wife and I have switched to headsets for use in the car - much less convenient, but much better audio quality.

For some reason I cannot change the # of stars I originally assigned, but it should be a two-star product, not 4 stars...
summary: Easy operation but not loud enough!

reviewText:
I received the 4-port USB Wall Charger for free to try and review; regardless this is my 100% honest opinion. I've been doing more research to better understand the various USB wall chargers and trying various types to see what works best for my family. This one you can plug up to 4 USB devices in at once, however you want to be sure you are using the proper slot for each type of device. The top two are for devices that need a stronger charger like tablets and the bottom two are better for smaller devices like phones. Also important are the cords that you use, this does not come with any cords so I highly recommend you use the cord that came with your device. If you plug a weaker cord into the top ports it will still give you a slower weaker charge. You can use any of the four ports and still get a charge on your device without harming it, it's all a matter of speed, a tablet is going to take FOREVER on the lower two!

This is white, and though blocky it is not a super eyesore like the power strips that we have been using to plug in multiple devices. This will be great when we have visitors so that they can plug their cords in and be ready to charge. Each family member in the household has 1-4 devices that charge via USB so it's nice to have these multiport chargers around the house so that we can use them when needed without having to prioritize which device (or family member) needs the outlet first!

I am giving this device a full five stars because it is exactly as described and also shown in pictures. However a couple things to take note of if you are looking at purchasing it. It will not fit behind a dresser/couch/etc unless it is pulled away from the wall. It plugs into the wall fully sticking out about plus room for the cord to plug in so you are going to need probably 4-5 inches of clearance in front of it. So unless you are plugging it into an outlet in a more open space this will not work for you if you need something in front of the plug. It could work under tables and along open walls with no problems. It's a couple inches wide as well, the size and weight at this time isn't pulling it out of the outlet yet and it is staying firm for us, but if you have loose outlets again this might be a problem. I really wish the person who designed this would have taken those things into consideration and flipped it so that the wall plug was on a side with more surface area keeping it closer to the wall when plugged in. It would also give it a slimmer profile and help so that people wouldn't need as much clearance around it. The ideal use for this is designed would probably be floor outlets, which don't exist in most buildings and even then usually only commercial buildings.

We will continue to use it as I said it works well for what it is. We have it plugged in near a couch on a wall that has some clearance between the wall and couch so it won't be blocked by anything.
summary: It is good and works, but the design is kind of awkward.

reviewText:
Guideline to decide if a screen protector like the Tech-Armor is suitable for your needs:

1. Do you work for a major computer chip manufacturer? If not, go to step 4.
2. Do you have access to a clean room and a bunny suit? If not, go to step 4.
3. Congratulations, you _may_ be able to apply the screen protector to a large surface like that of a Surface Pro 3 without trapping dozens of large dust particles between the film and your screen.
4. Just forget about it.
summary: dust-free application on large screens is impossible

The company says it is actual glass and perhaps it is, I couldn't say by feel alone but it is definitely not cheap flimsy plastic either. I followed the instructions on cleaning my screen and once I placed the glass screen protector on the tablet it seemed to almost set itself as I watched all of the air bubbles but one magically dissolve. One stubborn one stayed on the bottom edge but I lifted the edge slightly allowing it to release and it was gone. All the functions for my Galaxy 4 work fine with the screen protector in place and so far I see no finger prints being left behind as I use it. The protector I had previously, I admit I forgot was on there because there were so many finger prints on the screen I just assumed I never applied one! Not the case with this Pelson Tempered Glass Screen Protector. My tablet screen looks like I just took it out of the package and haven't so much as breathed on it yet!

Let's face it, there's nothing flashy or particularly exciting about a wall charger. The most important thing is performance. So, I ran some tests to see how the performance of the EasyAcc 5V 2A Micro USB Travel Charger compares to some other chargers I own.  For each test, I ran the battery on my HTC One M9 down to 30% capacity then charged for 30 minutes with the screen off.

The performance of the EasyAcc was very impressive. My phone increased 21% over 30 minutes which is fantastic. The only chargers that outperformed the EasyAcc were my two chargers that have Qualcomm Quick Charge 2.0 technology. Please note that Quick Charge technology only applies if you have a device that supports the technology.

Here are the results of each test:

* Motorola adapter and 6 ft cable: 8% increase
* Amazon 1A adapter and 3 ft cable: 14% increase
* Amazon 1A adapter and 6 ft cable: 14% increase
* My most powerful 2A portable charger: 21% increase
* EasyAcc 5V 2A Micro USB Travel Charger: 21% increase
* Car charger with Qualcomm Quick Charge 2.0 technology: 30% increase
* Wall charger with Qualcomm Quick Charge 2.0 technology: 34% increase

Here is a summary of the pros and cons with this charger:

Pros:
1) The 2 amp output provides a quicker charge than a standard charger. It's not as fast as Qualcomm's Quick Charge 2.0 technology but it's very impressive.
2) The cord is 5.5' long! This makes it great to use as a bedside charger and can also help for travel in case the outlet in your hotel room isn't in a convenient location.

Cons:
The only negative things I can think of about this charger are a bit petty. One is that it is a somewhat bulky and the other is that the cord is hardwired.

I highly recommend this charger for anyone looking for a powerful micro USB charger.

Please note that I received a free sample of this product from EasyAcc in exchange for this review.
summary: Great value for a powerful charger

reviewText:
The S5 Leather Flip is essentially a standard slim hardshell plastic case with leather backing and flip cover: feel of leather with hardshell protection. This is an extremely slim flip cover design, perhaps 1 millimeter thicker than a case without cover. It slips into my jean pockets with ease. It also fits on my phone like a glove, is attractive and the leather feels good in the hand. It's reasonably grippy and certainly more so than a plain plastic case. The Jean Indigo color is almost black and only looks blue in bright sunlight. The white plastic case imparts a nice accent and makes the phone easy to find in the dark.

I haven't dropped it but it should provide protection on par with an average plastic hardshell case. The ultra thin flip cover provides basic protection from scratches and is easy to fold out of the way. However, you can talk with it closed (there's a hole for the ear speaker). Although no latch or magnet, the flip cover folds and flat across the front of my iPhone.

The S5 Leather Flip appears well made but time will be the ultimate judge of quality, so I'll report back if it goes south. All in all a nice case: good looking, perfect fit, ultra slim and grippy.
summary: Good looking, ultra slim, grippy and fits the iPhone 5s like a glove

reviewText:
My review of KMASHI Fast Wireless Charger ,Wireless Charging Pad for Galaxy S7,Galaxy S7 Edge, Galaxy Note 5,Galaxy S6 Plus, S6 Edge+ and other QI Enabled Devices.

Shipping was quick with a few other items.

The charger itself is in a cardboard box with just a label.  Not really retail but it does say whats in it for you gift givers.

The package comes with the charger and a micro USB cable but not the wall adapter.  It also has a warranty card.

The charger has a smart charging system that shows you what charge is being delivered by the color of the LED.  Blue is slow charge, Orange is quick charge.  I was using a S6 for this and it has a pretty thick otterbox case on it and it was able to charge it.  It only had the blue led though.  I didn't see the orange come on but that could be the wall plug I was using too.  It also has to be placed right on it to charge.  If you're a little off it won't work.

Overall its a good budget charger just make sure your phone is compatible.  I have a S5 and now I want to buy the QI adapter for my S5 to see if it will charge it.

The only con so far is that it doesnt come with the wall adapter.  It kind of defeats the point of having another charger if you have to use your other wall plug.  I also think it would solve some of the issues other people might have with getting it to work with their phone.  If your wall plug doesnt put out enough power its not going to work right.

If you have any question please don't hesitate to ask. Ill be more than happy to help answer any questions if I can.

Ive attached pictures of the product I received below. Please note that I received the product for free or obtained the item at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.  All opinions are my own.  Your results may vary.  Thanks for taking the time to read my review.

The charging adapter works well and fit well on my Galaxy Note LTE. But on my S3 Mini, the lead going to the plug end was too long. Even with the top of the film just barely clearing the camera, there was a large loop of extra cable. I was able to fold the cable to get it to fit with just enough slack left to allow it to be unplugged for data cable use, but the sharp folds may lead to premature failure. I would have liked to be able to get a short lead model to fit my smaller phone. Another potential concern is the small loop of slack cable that has to be left if you want to remove the charging connector so you can use the micro-usb port for data transfers. In my application, this small loop is protected by the case. However, if your phone is bare or the case is thinner the slack loop may get caught on something and damaged.
summary: Works well, a bit large for smaller phones

MOTA iPhone 6 Plus/6s Plus Extended Battery Case, MOTA 4000 mAh Dual-Purposed Ultra-Slim Protective Extended Battery Charging Case - Black - Battery - Retail Packaging - BlackIt is a very very sleek case and does not add a lot of extra bulk to the iPhone. Provides good enough protection for the phone as well. Gives your phone the extra juice when required. At a press of a button you will know the remaining charge in the battery Has a Micro-USB port to charge the case(Dislike for me) as i have to carry 2 usb cables now. Would i use it daily? NO..Definitely NO.. IMHO, this is best suited when you travel or it is a necessity for someone who is always on the go. This case will be very handy for such cases where you are out the entire day and it will give the extra boost when your iPhone is about to run out of battery. Pros Very very Sleek and adds very less bulk to your sleek iphone The case(bumper) has different colors to choose from (Go ahead customize your phone). I just went for a simple Black one. Easy to use installation The case in itself charges fairly quickly. Charges the iPhone fairly quickly (still need to test the numbers claimed by Mota- Will update my review if i anything odd) Comes in a nice packaging and Instructions. Cons The bumper part of the case needs to be removed every time you need to install the iPhone. This bumper is the weak point according to me. Just after two times of installing and removing the phone, the bumper case squeaks and is lose in some places now. Check my attached pics. The case itself needs a Micro-USB cable. I feel the USB slot on the case is a little clumsy(has a cheap feel to it). Cable won't fit fine and i feel the slot/port might break easily if i am not careful. Supplied micro-USB cable is kind of short Have to carry an extra head phone jack with this case(Mota does provides this jack, but i don't like extra junk with me) It is pricey case. Form the quality and whole device feel.. i wish it could have costed a little less. Summary This case is not for everyday use and not for everyone(mainly because of the price). If you travel a lot or infact if you use your phone a lot (i.e drain the huge iPhone 6+ battery in half a day) then this is FOR YOU. So IMHO, think about your needs before buying. The case in itself is absolutely fine (even with the cons that i suggested above). It is a MOTA device, their customer service is great, they are always there for your help. I am Happy with the case so far...
summary: Juice when u need it! Excellent

reviewText:
I have been using the Jabra for about 3 months, in anticipation of the California hands-free law. While I like the slim, sleek design, I would prefer a couple of big buttons instead of the single one. It took me a while to learn the difference between the "press" and the "tap", so I was transferring calls to the handset when I meant to hang up. And I never did get the right pressure for answering. I rigged my phone to have the Jabra answer automatically after two rings -- MUCH better and much safer!

The volume is just loud enough with my Samsung phone jacked up to high - I just have to remember to lower the phone volume when I do hand-hold it, or everyone around me hears my caller's voice.

I agree that the battery life is amazing. (I got mine at Costco, and the AC adapter was included.) I like the auto-off feature, as I usually forget to turn it off when I leave the car. I prefer using the visor speakerphone over a headset -- no geek factor, and I have the use of both ears to hear the stereo or conversation in my car, which I don't have when a headset blocks one ear.

The indicator lights could be brighter; in the daytime, they are too small and too dim to be useful. For this level of function, the price is right, though.
summary: Does what I need, but a little tricky to learn

I received this case in two days. It came in a sealed package, which is always good to know it comes in brand new packaging. I love the color, even though mine is a little more on the green side, and not so much teal as pictured. This case comes in 3 pieces; a solid black hard rubber that covers the back, and then the teal/green shell that goes over that- and the belt clip case as well. The case fits very nicely, and leaves all ports and holes open and easily accessible. I am confident that if i drop my phone, this case will protect it. One of the things i like most, is that the black body cover has a lip over the front of the screen, so that if i were to drop my phone screen side down, the lip will protect this screen from getting any scratches or damage to it. The belt clip took me a minute to figure out, i couldn't get the phone to stay put, it kept sliding out, so make sure you put the belt clip on the front of the phone, facing the screen. I'm not sure why i tried to put it on the back side but it doesn't work like that. This is a very sturdy and stylish case, and i love that it fits my LGK7 phone just as it should!

The Jawbone lives up to its claim of clear sound, but is difficult to adjust, not as secure in my ear as my last headset, and hurts my ear with prolonged use. Since I bought it for the sound quality (both on my end and the listener) I gave it four stars, but the lack of a secure fit and discomfort it causes are significant distractions.

The included manual is significantly lacking in information. I finally got online and read the online manual to figure out how to adjust it and make use of its features. I don't understand the lack of information. The proprietary charging system is a distractor as well. They should have gone with a generic USB style charging system so I can just use a cable to recharge it.

All-in-all I like it, but think the fit, documentation, and charging system certainly can be improved upon.

Updated Jan 5, 2009: I continue to like it, but have found that unless you keep it tight against your cheek, people on the other end have a difficult time understanding me.  It does prove difficult to keep it against my cheek.  It will also disconnect from the phone and must be turned off and restarted to reconnect.  This happens periodically during a conversation and without any seeming similarity in occurrence.

reviewText: Very easy to install.
Pairs up easily. Comfortable, beeps when on mute, no background noise.  Looking for a very good priced headset, this is it.  !!!

Over the past few years, I've become a collector of Bluetooth headsets for my phones.  I did not intend to start a collection.  Most were adequate, but all had some key flaw that just made it too much of a bother to use for one reason or another.

The Jabra STORM Bluetooth headset will be the last in my "collection," and I can finally get rid of all the others.  This one is perfect for me.

To start with, it looks good.  Not the key reason to get one for me, or to get rid of one, but it's a nice plus.  It feels good when you wear it, which is a major plus and why a couple of my previous headsets are out the door.  It connects well with my phone, and very easily.  Comes up as "Jabra STORM" on the Bluetooth menu, instead of "LRx335.5a" or some such nonsense.  Again, not really a showstopper, but it makes me happy.  It works very well.  Friends, family, and business partners can all easily understand me without having to shout or change my normal speaking voice, and I can understand all of them.  This is a critical issue, and the STORM delivers very, very well.

But for me, the thing that drives it home is power management.  I only use a headset when in the car, or occasionally when I'm expecting an important call and otherwise will have my hands busy.  So having a battery that lasts a long time is very important, and the STORM delivers.  I can talk for hours if I need to, such as on a long car drive.  Once charged, if I turn it off it will keep a charge for over a month, even with intermittent use.  One big reason it can do that is because it has a physical on-off switch.  Seriously, why can't more headsets do that?  It doesn't waste the battery that way, and I don't hear a quiet voice or beep hours later after I use it when it's trying to connect to a phone that isn't there...you can actually turn the headset off.  I absolutely love that!

Are there phones out there that do some feature better?  Sure, heck I have a couple.  Some are smaller, some look better, some sound better, others have cool features I'll never use but they sound good at the time.  But overall, I haven't found a better headset, and I can finally stop searching.  This one is fantastic for everything I need it to do, and more!

Highly recommended!
summary: Overall best headset I have ever found!

reviewText:
I completely trashed my old review because although, as I always, I field tested this product my review was largely based on past experience with other similar products which I stopped using or just plain lost without even thinking about it.

I'm not a person who talks on the phone while driving, walking, eating, exercising, or sitting on the toilet.  Those are just bad habits.  In fact, in the past, I've used the phone so little that I had begun asking myself if maybe I just don't need one since I have my iPad and prefer to e-mail, text, or use Facetime.  I easily send more photos with e-mails to my friends and family members than I call.

Holding the phone to my ear is tiresome, I can't do anything else while I'm using the phone that way, and the other ear pieces I've used were uncomfortable both to wear and listen to.

Since I've been using this Jabra model, all that has changed.  I've been talking on the phone more, as I should, and this device frees me up on ways I didn't expect.

The range is amazing.  Using my iPhone 5, I can place the phone anywhere and I have no signal problems walking around without the phone anywhere else in my home.

I can lay down with it, even resting on the ear I have the device on, without any discomfort, even after a long conversation.

And the sound is as clear as it is when holding the iPhone to my ear.

A full charge gives you two hours of talk time, and all you have to do to find out how much time you have left is press the button on the end of the earpiece--a voice will actually say "Your remaining talk time is ____ hours."  A good amount of time before it runs out of power, it gives you a warning--which I forget because it has only happened once.

The 'stone' the earpiece sits in charges the earpiece, so most of the time you don't need to plug it into an outlet, just insert it into the stone and the three indicator lights on the stone will tell you how much of a charge is left before you need to plug that back into a wall outlet or USB port.

Lastly, both in terms of safety and comfort, I like how this device gives you 'in ear' sound quality but doesn't block your ear from hearing other things around you--which is my key issue with wearing one while driving or hiking.

BOTTOM LINE: I've finally converted to being a wireless earpiece user--though of course I still won't be abusing it with bad habits like talking on the phone while on trains or walking down the street.
summary: A Re-Review: I underestimated how much I would like and use this thing

I feel like my iPhone is constantly dying - the battery drains so quickly, and if I am out and about I get stranded with a dead phone. That is why I LOVE portable chargers (aka power banks).

The Cynphon JumpStart JS-2400 Portable Charger is small and lightweight so it can easily be slipped into your bag  or desk drawer. It is compatible with iPhone 6, 5, 5S, 5C, 4S, 4, iPod, and Samsung Galaxy S3, S4.

The Cynphon comes in 3 colors silver, blue, or fuchsia. I selected the Fuchsia, and it really looks more like red to me. This is not a huge deal for me, as I don't care about what color it is as much as I care about how it works. But, it is something to consider if you really wanted a Fuchsia portable charger.

What I love most about this particular brand of portable charger is that it comes with not only a Micro USB cable, but also iPhone 5/4 adapters and Samsung Galaxy Adapter.

I have a thing for portable chargers. I have about 8 of them. I keep them all charged up, all the time, so that they are ready when hubby or I need them. We use them very often, and I don't know how we ever survived without them. Portable chargers like the Cynphon JumpStart are lifesavers. Do yourself a favor and buy 1 or 5 :)

I use my Raspberry Pi in conjunction with a Pogoplug Series 4 to satisfy my needs for a HTPC solution. I used to run my main PC with two external HDD shared out and then a laptop connected to each TV. This worked great but was inefficient and consumed a lot of power. Since my main TV was smart and had Hulu/YouTube apps, I decided to configure my Pi with Raspbmc and to ditch my main PC with the Pogoplug Series 4 using Debian and Samba as a file server. My power bill dropped enough to make it worth the 60$ spent on the Pi and the 20$ spent on the Pogoplug.

Here is why I used Pogoplug and why the Pi isn't an end all solution for HTPC solutions: So the Pi B splits it's Ethernet connection with the USB bus (which is limited to USB 2.0 so your network bandwidth and USB bandwidth are shared). This made XBMC significantly slower when reading movies/tv shows even when the external HDD was connected directly to the device. So by switching to the Pogoplug as my file server I not only reduced the amount of buffering the Pi needs to stream a video, I now have a device that is capable of USB 3.0 and has Gigabit Ethernet (for whenever I get a router capable of 1gbps).  Now I can access file shares, movies, and manage downloads without having my Raspberry Pi as a bottleneck.

There are other great applications that the Raspberry Pi can be used for and it's a great little gadget to learn Linux.  Certainly happy with my purchase. The biggest downside is no native flash support and even when you can get it to work, it is unusable as the Pi just doesn't have enough processing power to handle flash.
summary: ... Pi in conjunction with a Pogoplug Series 4 to satisfy my needs for a HTPC solution

This battery pack is beautifully packaged with black case. It is a powerful battery pack rated at 8000 mAh of capacity and the test results were good! I put together a video of the unit and the test results for your review. The battery weighs in at 6 7/8 ounces. The battery pack has one USB output port that outputs 5 VDC at 1 Amp and a second USB port that outputs 2.1 Amps. During the testing the temperature of the battery pack never even exceeded ambient room temperature. To start your phone or device charging you connect it with the proper cable and press the battery power button. To check the battery pack charge status you have to press the battery power button and the LEDs on the front light up. This product is good and I rate it at 5 stars. If you are a business person or a student and have to depend on your tablet or smart phone for long periods of time without the ability to get to an AC power source then this is a good battery to own. This is good for those who travel a lot or camp out. Now you can watch your movies or listen to your music on those long airline flights. While this battery pack can put some charge into your tablets it is more ideal for use in recharging your smart phone. Because of its size it is great to drop into a purse, briefcase or a pocket. You should note that I did not operate my tablets or phones while I charged it but the WIFI and phone transmitter were left on. When I test a battery I do an extensive set of tests that fully charges the battery and then I use it to charge devices and make sure that it is fully depleted when my tests are done. I time each test and document the results as the test progresses. I then calculate the mAh of capacity that the battery supplied and I then calculate its charging efficiency. This process takes from 3 hours to, in very large batteries, about a day for testing. I don't take any short cuts or guess and every battery has these tests performed on it and documented. This is to assure that the battery is tested and it performs well. If a battery has performed poorly I then run the tests again to verify the results. Items in the box: * The UNU Enerpak 8000 mAh battery * The battery pack comes with an instruction manual. * A USB charging cable that is 32 inches long. * You may have to use the charging cable that comes with many of your own devices. * The unit does not come with a USB AC charging power source. UNU Enerpak 8000 mAh External Battery Pack Features: * Powerful 8000 mAh capacity * The unit is compact and weighs in at 6 7/8 ounces. * Attractive design with a black exterior. * The specifications and ports are nicely labeled on the case. * It has 3 LED status lights located on the front that indicate the battery charge level. When you see one red LED the battery is between 5 and 33 %, 2 green LEDs is 33 to 66 %, 3 blue LEDs is 66 to 100%. * There is one USB power output rated at 5 VDC and 1 Amp labeled Smartphones and a second USB port rated at 2.1 Amps that is labeled Tablets. * You can charge two items at the same time. * When you plug in a device then press the charging button to start the process of charging your device. * The battery pack uses Lithium-ion battery technology. * The battery pack can be recharged 500+ times * Warranty is 12 months * The battery pack does not come with an AC wall charger. It is specified to be charged with 5 VDC at 1 amp. That manual states that you can use a 2.1 Amp power source and I recommend that you use 2.1 Amps. The manual specifies that it will take 8 to 10 hours to charge the battery with a 1Amp power source. * The battery pack features a dual LED flashlight that can be turned on by double pressing the on button twice quickly and it can be turned off by double pressing the off button twice quickly. This is a nice feature to use when looking for your keys, finding a seat in a dark theater or while in a dark unfamiliar hotel room at night and looking for a light switch. It is also good for emergencies. Test charging devices to measure the output capacity: I fully charged the battery pack and it was at 3 blue LEDs of charge capacity. My test iPad 2 was at 8%. * 30 min iPad at 17% 4 LEDs * 60 min iPad at 27% 4 LEDs * 90 min iPad at 36% 3 LEDs * We charged the iPad 2 overnight and in the morning it was at 93% and the battery pack was dead Summary of charging tests: * Charge an iPad 2 85% x 6944 = 5902.4 mAh * Test result = 5902.4 mAh/8000 mAh = 74% efficiency * That is a good efficiency result for this battery. Here are some common devices and the amount of mAh of capacity they have when they are fully charged. This is just to give you an impression of how much energy it takes to charge your smart device: * iPhone 4 battery 1,420 mAh battery capacity * iPhone 4S battery 1,432 mAh battery capacity * iPhone 5 battery 1440 mAh battery capacity * iPhone 5S battery 1560 mAh battery capacity * iPad 2 battery 6,944 mAh battery capacity * iPad 3 battery 11,560 mAh battery capacity * Kindle Fire battery 4400 mAh capacity * Kindle Keyboard battery 1750 mAh capacity * iPad 4 battery is 11,486 mAh 3.7 VDC at 42.5 Wh * iPad Mini battery is 4490 mAh at 3.72 VDC 16.7 Wh As you can see the UNU Enerpak 8000 will not fully charge a totally dead iPad 2, 3 or 4 because it only contains 8000 mAh of capacity. You have to consider the losses in the charging circuits of both the battery pack and the device you are charging. When using an external battery you have to allow approximately 30 % of the battery capacity will be lost to heat, voltage conversion, powering the batteries electronics and the electronics of your electronics device's charging circuits. In addition you have to consider that your device is not truly off like a cell phone is still connected to the WIFI and phone networks and probably receiving emails, etc. Real world examples of charging capability with this battery pack: * iPhone 4 approximately 416% of a full charge out of a fully charged UNU Enerpak 8000 mAh battery pack * iPhone 5S approximately 378% of a full charge * iPad 2 approximately 85% of a full charge * iPad 3 or 4 approximately 51% of a full charge * iPad Mini approximately 131% of a full charge * Kindle Fire approximately 134% of a full charge * A normal estimated usable storage is 70% of capacity or .70 * 8000 mAh = 5600 mAh charging capacity available for your electronic devices. * In my testing I was able to use approximately 5719.76 mAh of capacity or roughly 74% of the 8000 mAh capacity. This is a good result. I received a sample product for evaluation and I promised to provide a fair and honest review.
summary: A good battery with solid test results!

This case is the happy medium between the ultra-sleek OtterBox SYMMETRY SERIES Case for iPhone 7 Plus (ONLY) - Frustration Free Packaging - BLACK, not currently available on Amazon in my favorite color Bespoke Way, and the OtterBox DEFENDER SERIES Case for iPhone 7 Plus (ONLY) - Frustration Free Packaging - BESPOKE WAY (BLAZER BLUE/STORMY SEAS BLUE). If you think the Defender might be too bulky (it is very bulky) and the Symmetry not protective enough (it really is but it doesn't promise 2-layer protection), then THIS is the Otterbox case for you. While the Defender feels obese and quite heavy, the Commuter manages to be pretty light weight despite only remove one piece (the front/screen protector piece) that the Defender has. The pieces themselves are also MUCH lighter than the Defender pieces and like the Defender, it provides port covers to keep stuff out of your phone. (I almost found the two pieces too fragile and light in my hands.) The rubbery piece is very lightweight, much, much lighter than the Symmetry and not as protective without the inner plastic piece. The Commuter definitely FEELS like and is the budget version of the other sturdier Otterbox cases. I think this is the case most people would be happy with if they're not completely klutzes and if they don't necessarily carry their phones in their pockets...though this is a pretty easy fit in your pocket though not as light and small as the slimmer Symmetry. I got this in Bespoke Way because the color is more uniform and more stylish than the black case. The other colors are too loud for me and I don't like the combinations, especially Aqua Mint Way though Rosmarine Way is pretty decent too as far as no clashing color combinations. Though the Commuter doesn't come with a screen protector, I think the OtterBox ALPHA GLASS SERIES Screen Protector for iPhone 7 Plus (ONLY) - Retail Packaging - CLEAR is the prefect Otterbox addition to this case if you want to keep things in the family. If you find the Defender too heavy and the Symmetry too thin (though honestly, the Commuter feels somehow thinner despite two layers), this is te case for you. My best friend swears by this but my money (and yes, you spend more) is with the Defender, Strada or Symmetry cases. For a phone as big as the iPhone 7 Plus, I have to recommend the Symmetry and Strada but if you need to save money then the Commuter since you'll need to buy a screen protector separately is your best bet.

However, after a week the mount began to pull the sticky part off of my dash. In the end it came off and I had to instead attack it to the windshield. At least it did not leave any sticky residue on the dash.

Some thoughts: the ball joint that allows you to swivel the phone around does not have enough tension. This results in the phone not staying in place.

Bottom line: After a few months of dealing with several annoying features with this item I decided to buy a Kenu Airframe vent mount from Amazon. I am 100% happy with my Kenu and wish I had spent the 10 bucks extra at the start. Now I am stuck with the FunTM mount that I will never use.

First off, I will state I am not a fan of cases on my phones at all so I am somewhat bias against them.
The HTC One (M8) is a nice phone but the aluminum on the back is very slick and will not stay on any uneven surfaces.  This was my only reason for looking for a case.

The TUDIA Melody case does a good job of fitting the bill for what I was looking for.  It is not super grippy and stick in the pocket but grips enough to stay on most surfaces without problems.
They do a good job of leaving enough room around the buttons, camera/flash, and input slots to not cause problems (interfering with usb/headphone cords or making it difficult to press the buttons).  Also the rubber over the volume buttons does not make it difficult to press them, if anything it may help make the distinction between volume up and down a little more defined.

I have purchased two of these, the black one for my phone and the purple for my wife's.  We have had no problems with them and my wife likes hers.
My "ideal" case would have been a paper thin film that gives the phone more grip.  That doesn't exist so this is a good alternative (my reason for 4 stars, I don't "love it").

reviewText:
Update

This device works well in China and HK. I have no complaint. The speed is usable for my iOS devices.

The only negative is that the data packages now being offered are different to those offered at the outset. There no longer appears to be a 3GB global package, but there is one for HK and China combined at about $30

While there are packages in Asia combining certain countries, there are no specific European packages meaning you have to buy a global package. The Global package is a single 1GB one and the price is now much higher than I paid before.

I guess the reason for this is that the manufacturer is China/HK based.

The concept of this device is great. A single device that works when you get off the plane anywhere in the world. But it needs sensible pricing and right  sized data packages. And availability of the device seems very limited and I could not find it for sale in HK. I'd buy a G2 which is a 4G device that also accepts local SIM cards if I could find one. Guess I will have to buy one in the USA when I get back

I upped the rating to 4 ****

=====================================================
I bought this item to replace an unlocked wifi device and a handful of SIM's for both Europe and Asia.

My first experience was to use it in the USA by way of an initial test. It connected OK to the network and provided data. The speeds were very low and in my opinion not useable for normal email retrieval and web browsing was not useful

I ran quite a number of  speedtests in a number of locations over a 2-3 week period. In my home town I use ATT and can get impressive service on my cellphone, but the best I got on the G1 was under 2- 3Mbs download and 1Mb upload and the test reported using ATT as the carrier.  In Las Vegas - the same - situation with really low speeds. I am sure that this is not a limitation of the hardware but rather that of the roaming terms with the various providers that the internal SIM locks onto.

The unit itself is robust and quite chunky but not obtrusive. Its easy to use and seems to function. Just the performance is lacking

Hope I see better results when I am traveling further afield
summary: Useful in Asia. Not tried in Eu yet. USA is slow.

First, a note about the "nozzle plugging" problem cited elsewhere.  This is a spray product.  Just like spray paint, if you don't empty the nozzle, the product can set up solid and block it.

The way you use it, you spray it on the applicator cloth, then wipe it on the screen.  Make the last couple of sprays with the can upside down, and the sprayer will suck air in, and the nozzle won't plug.  I've used mine several times over the course of a week, and it hasn't plugged yet.

I also protected a cheap plastic watch crystal that was prone to scratching, and it hasn't scratched yet, so it does seem to do what it says it does.  Just be prepared to not use the device for a few hours while the stuff sets up.  And whatever you do, DO NOT go back and add more until the first coat has set overnight.  it will do nothing but scrudge up your screen.  Not permanent, but not pretty.
summary: Works as advertised, easy to apply

reviewText:
Have used this for months and can say this about their fancy "Q" intelligence; it's 99% great on 99% of our devices, but not 100% compatible with certain devices that require their own special chargers.  It seems to be some kind of copy-protection to force you to use the manufacturer's own charger, not in my opinion the fault of Anker, so they still get a 5-star rating from me.

Examples of things that do WORK if you use the MANUFACTURER cables:  iPhone 5, iPad 2, PSP, Xbox One controllers, Wii U controllers.  (interestingly the iPhone 5 and Xbox One won't charge with any cable except for the original cables, which makes me think the copy-protection is built-into those cables).

Examples of things that DO NOT work with this charger NO MATTER WHAT YOU DO or cables you use:  Xbox 360-E controllers, Playstation 4 controllers.  (even using the original cables, certain things simply refuse to charge without the original manufacturer-licensed/approved chargers).
summary: Not 100% compatible with everything, but super-fast charging for everything else is great!

reviewText:
Like the title said, it works for 5 minutes and then doesn't work.

So I open up the package, pair it with my phone and test it. It pairs fast and easy. I stream music to test the sound quality first. It seems just ok, not very loud but it sounded like an headphone from 1985. The music played for 5 minutes and then the sound drop down to a level that I can barely hear it. I thought it just the music streaming problem so I went to test with a phone call. More problems came in this time. First, it won't answer phone by voice commend. You'll answer it by pressing the button on it or answer by your phone. Second, once it answered, there's no sound can be heard from both end. It seems like it was being disconnected. Even you route the call to the phone and back to the Q2, it won't work.

So incoming call not work. I go ahead to test with outgoing call. It went through no problem. However, the voice will stuck at that low level I can't even hear it. It's the same volume level as to it went bad when I stream music.

The design is not impress at all. I just don't like the volume button on the side so every time you wear it, you'll hit on them by accident every time you wear it. Needless to say, it'll goes back to Amazon.
summary: It works for 5 minutes and then doesn't work

My first dashcam and since I really can't compare this to any other devices, I'd have to say that I'm very happy with my purchased.  I've searched other devices on amazon but for the cost and from reading other reviews I decided to go with this unit (...not to mention the free 32GB SD card).  I have it installed in my car in less than 15 mins tucking the cable along the windshield and the roof on my Pilot.  I ran the cable down the door sealed and to the bottom of the passenger glove compartment and the still have about a foot of cable left.  Make sure you clean the windshield with a cleaner first for it to stick securely.  I've had it for 2 weeks and never fell on me yet.

The camera is very easy to use.  I went through the instruction once and it's very easy to follow.  It comes on when I start the car and I have it set to 10 seconds delay after turning off the engine.  The screen can be set to turn off automatically or have it on all the time.  You can set it to record audio or have it off.  One touch of a button to lock and save the video so you don't accidently delete it.  There is no GPS on this camera and I don't know how it will stand in a car in the summer heat, but it looks and feel like a quality product.

I would highly recommend this dashcam.

reviewText:
This would be a pretty brazen knockoff.  This appears to be an OEM LG battery from an Asian market. It had 0% when I installed it and took fast charging right away. I'll update this review if anything major happens.

Left pic is what I received from this listing, right pic is an OEM US market LG G5 battery.

PROS
-- Ultra thin, almost like wearing a cell phone condom
-- Brown really brings out the gold color in the phone
-- Cap on charging port is nice

CONS
-- Jacks up the flash in your photos (see pictures)

THOUGHTS
I originally owned a clear TPU case that was thicker.  I love that the TPU cases feel snug and "wrap" around the phone.  I wanted something thinner that also didn't make pushing one volume button feel like pushing both, as it was hard to take screenshots.  I scooped this one up and immediately loved it as it felt very noticeably thinner.  The door for the charging port is a little thicker than the rest of the case, but that didn't phase me.  What really got on my nerves was that the TPU messes up with the flash.  By having TPU so close to the flash is what causes it, and this design flaw is why I'm only rating it 3 stars.  I was given this product for full price in exchange for an honest review.

PICTURE CAPTION
One was taken with this cover on and the other was taken bare naked.
The tray on top doesn't fit back down inside once things are plugged in to a power strip
great for the price, light and compact to carry around, fits all my devices with case on,
Great product and great price.  love it!

Review after 15 months of use... Dual layer bi-material cases are definitely the way to go for protection. I enjoyed the protection this gave my phone and the solid grip that the textured plastic back supplied. However it frequently got stuck in jean pockets.  Finally the edge seemed to catch in the pocket liner and cracked by the volume nob. This crack would catch on my ear and all attempts to pocket the phone.
The outer shell was originally quite tight and was hard to remove; however, after a first removal (Android phones do lock up on certain apps), it never seemed to fit as tight which probably lead to the shell edge catching.  I tried the Otter Box Defender case but sent it back because it doubles the thickness of the phone.  My wife is also happy with the otter box Commuter.  But if you need a case with a good grip this is definitely the one to use and it is less expensive than Otter Box so replacing it on these breaks is reasonable.  Wish they sold it with several shells.
summary: Broke after 1 year of use (no drops)

I liked this keyboard a lot - solid build, great fit on the Mini... Cramped, but no surprise given the dimensions of the Mini. But the deal killer is the right shift key - same size as the letter keys, half of the size of the left shift key. Must have been to accomodate the arrow keys. For me, bad choice. I was never able to train my right pinkie to find that shift key - I really had to look for it. Whatever chance I had at touch typing died with that dinky right shift key. So the left shift is good...but not the right!

I went for a Logitech Ultrathin Keyboard Cover and although still cramped, it has a proper right shift key... until the keyboard wouldn't charge...but that's another review!
summary: Left is right ... And the right is wrong!

reviewText: I wish it had a bit more magic goo around the stylus corner.  I've used Tech21 impact cases for 3 different phones and always loved them.  This is no exception.  This is the only "low profile" Tech21 case I've ever had.  I couldn't find their more ruggedized version for this phone.  Still, I like this case.  The wrap is just enough to be able to lay it face down on a flat surface and not worry about scratching the screen.

Just to let you know, there is a trick to doing this correctly. first and formost the package comes with a lint free cloth to clean the screen. Second is the "soft card" to squeeze and air bubbles out of it. it's a soft piece of cardboard to slide across the screen protector and not damage it and or to remove it, if needed. (if done properly, not required)

most importantly is the screen protector itself. when you first look at it, all you see is a clear piece of plastic and a little tab attached to it. It's important to read what it says. the tab is glued onto a piece of plastic which is attached to the protector. hold itby it's sidesand pull on the tab slowly. this should begin to seperate the tabbed plastic sheet from the protector. it's like peeling off the protective paper from the back of a bow or ribbon or double sided tape with paper on it.

try not to touch the back, hold it by the sides if possible. lay the phone flat on it's back for the next part. Center the protector to the screen and just let it drop onto it or place one edge on the screen and drop it. It should appear to be floating on screen since you will notice the air gap. Give it a few seconds and gravity should do it's job and simply suck all the air out from between the screen and the protector without touching it. Once it's done, you can use the cloth to get the prints and stuff off the screen. It's a perfect fit and I don't have any air bubbles on it.
summary: there is a trick to this

The box package is small, simple and attractive which is what i like about Anker products. This combo comes with 10050 mAh capacity and 1 USB outputs 5V = 2.4A, 9V = 2A, 12V = 1.5A PowerBank with IQ Technology, Qualcomm 2.0 quick charger and cloth mess bag (which i am not big fan of, more about that later in review).

The package comes with PowerCore+ 10050 mAh battery with LED indicator makes the product look futuristic. I love LED indicator on this product compare to other out there with color coding. You really have to remember what % represents Green , Blue and Red. So far this is my favorite product in terms of LED battery indicator. Some people may feel battery pack little bulky but for 10050 mAh capacity, weight is justified. Overall, battery packs looks and feels good. It doesn't feel like plastic or made form cheap material. The power pack color is matt black with non-shiny surface which I liked a lot. The package also includes micro USB cable and Qualcomm 2.0 quick wall charger for quick charge time. I was bale to charge my iPhone almost 3 times with one full charge cycle.

I was not expecting a carrying cases like this. It is little flimsy mesh cloth bag; the battery pack, charger and cable snugly fits inside.. I really like to keep all the contents inside the bag however hard case would have been better for protection. I have seen better cases out there. Since, carrying case was included for free, there is not much to complaint about.

Overall, Anker PowerCore+ Quick Charge Combo pack is a very nice set of devices perfect for travelling. Each component is of high quality and performs very well.

All in all, very solid Combo Package and I would hope to see Anker starts doing more of this to help users pair the proper products that compliment each other. It can get quite confusing with different Quick Charges (2.0/3.0) and which products they are compatible with.
I have received the item at a reduced price in return for an fair and unbiased review based on my user experience.
summary: Excellent small PowerBank with carry pouch and charger
